placeMetadata.name: Kovalam Beach

sources.snippet: Kovalam is the most famous beach in Kerala and consists of three pretty crescent-shaped beaches with great names ‚Äì Lighthouse Beach, Samudra Beach, and Hawah Beach, which had been a sleepy village until the 1960s with narrow lanes and wide courtyards for drying fish as well as thatched dwellings with dry coconut leaves. Kovalam was well known as the focal point of the hippie life in India. But things took on a slightly more demure attitude later and the beach is now well known for seaside sports, ayurvedic treatments, and exotic beach shacks.

sources.snippet: Vizhinjam is a natural port located close to international shipping routes in Thiruvananthapuram city in the Indian state of Kerala.Vizhinjam International Seaport is an international deepwater multi-purpose shipping hub in its initial stages of development.Vizinjam Beach is approximately 1.9 miles (3 kilometers) from Kovalam.Vizhinjam has been a sea port since ancient times and archeological evidence has revealed that the Romans came here to trade. The centuries-old fishing industry is still very much alive here today.The Vizhinjam Lighthouse, situated close to the Vizhinjam harbour, gives you a celestial view of the Arabian sea and the western coast of Southern Kerala.The public entry timings are restricted to the light house.

Vizhinjam Beach is a picturesque coastal area located near the Vizhinjam village in Thiruvananthapuram district, Kerala, India. Here are some key features and information about Vizhinjam Beach:

1. **Location:** Vizhinjam Beach is situated around 17 kilometers from the city center of Thiruvananthapuram, the capital city of Kerala. It lies to the south of the city and is easily accessible by road.

2. **Scenic Beauty:** Vizhinjam Beach is known for its natural beauty, with golden sands, clear blue waters, and rocky cliffs. The beach offers breathtaking views of the Arabian Sea and is surrounded by lush greenery, making it an ideal destination for nature lovers and photographers.

3. **Fishing Community:** The Vizhinjam area is home to a traditional fishing community, and visitors to the beach can witness local fishermen engaged in their daily activities. The sight of colorful fishing boats dotting the shoreline adds to the charm of the beach.

4. **Tourist Attractions:** In addition to its natural beauty, Vizhinjam Beach offers various attractions for tourists. Nearby, visitors can explore the historic Vizhinjam Rock Cut Cave Temple, which dates back to the 8th century and features intricate rock-cut sculptures dedicated to Hindu gods and goddesses.

5. **Water Sports:** Vizhinjam Beach is also a popular destination for water sports enthusiasts. Activities such as swimming, snorkeling, and scuba diving are available for those seeking adventure and excitement.

6. **Cultural Events:** Throughout the year, Vizhinjam Beach hosts various cultural events and festivals, showcasing the rich cultural heritage of Kerala. These events often include traditional music and dance performances, as well as local cuisine stalls offering delicious seafood delicacies.

Overall, Vizhinjam Beach is a tranquil and scenic destination where visitors can relax, unwind, and immerse themselves in the beauty of nature while experiencing the vibrant culture of Kerala's coastal communities.

Veli Beach, located about 10 km from the heart of Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, is a peaceful and scenic destination ideal for a relaxing getaway. Nestled where the Veli Lake meets the Arabian Sea, the beach offers stunning views and a calm atmosphere, far from the crowds of more commercialized spots. It‚Äôs part of the Veli Tourist Village, which features attractions like a children‚Äôs park, pedal boating, horse riding, landscaped gardens with sculptures, and a floating restaurant‚Äîmaking it especially appealing for families. The area is well-maintained, with a minimal entry fee and activities available daily from morning to evening. Easily accessible by road, rail, or air, Veli Beach is best visited between October and February when the weather is pleasant. With its blend of natural beauty and leisure activities, it provides a serene and enjoyable experience for visitors of all ages.

sources.snippet: At southwestern tip of India is Thiruvananthapuram, Capital of Kerala, bound by Arabian Sea in west and Tamil Nadu in east and named after Anantha Padmanabha or Lord Vishnu also home to many ancient temples, all importantly Sree Padmanabha Swamy Temple around which the city is built on seven low hills. The wood highlands of Western Ghats at east and northeast borders awards enchanting picnic spots. A shoreline of world renowned beaches, historic monuments, backwater stretches and rich cultural heritage make the district an enthralling tourist destination.

reviews.reviewText:
I had the most wonderful stay at Niraamaya Surya Samudra, Kovalam and I can‚Äôt thank the entire team enough for the unforgettable experience. üå∫

From the moment we arrived, everything was flawless ‚Äî the warm welcome, the serene atmosphere and the breathtaking views .The property is truly a hidden gem, combining natural beauty with luxurious comfort.A special mention to the staff ‚Äî so kind, attentive and always smiling. The service was exceptional in every way, whether it was room service, restaurant staff or the spa team. üíØTruly one of the finest stays I‚Äôve ever had. I would highly recommend Niraamaya to anyone looking for a luxurious, serene and soulful beach retreat in Kerala.
Can‚Äôt wait to return! üåä‚ú®

A beautiful resort tucked away on the sea shores with coconut trees spread over acres of land, this resort is so laid back and relaxing you forget the count of days, We spent 3nights just chilling outside our cottage watching the boats and ships sail by ever so slowly.
The food is yummy and freshly cooked, the service is simply awesome from the ever smiling staff of Niraamaya resort. We will be surely back for the massage that we missed out this time.

We had a wonderful experience at this property near Vizhinjam. The highlight is undoubtedly the stunning port view, which adds to the charm of this calm and serene location. The rooms are spacious and well-maintained.

We opted for a day outing and thoroughly enjoyed the infinity pool, which was a delightful experience. However, the food was average and could be improved. The biggest drawback is the lack of sufficient parking, which can be inconvenient. Additionally, the pricing is on the higher side.

Overall, it's a great place for relaxation, especially if you're looking for a peaceful retreat with a breathtaking view and budget is not a concern.

Located around 1KM from the service road of vizhinjam kovalam road and has a proper road connectivity.Resort looks natural all around with the sea view. Vizhinjam Port can be seen very near. Welcome drink given was tender coconut. Rooms are very spacious and food served is tasty and had a good choic. Beautiful sea facing pool, indoor games(carroms and chess), evening can indulge in pot making. Ayurveda spa and massage is available. Property has good photo spot and a beach access. Stunning view of sea and port.

A great place to stay!

The team are super friendly and cater to all needs. The setting is beautiful, short walk to a beach and it has its own pool. The food was a standout for us, lots of varieties of curries to indulge in.

Some of the guests were a bit rude but I guess that is to be expected when you stay at a resort.

Located on beach side with lush green surroundings with beautiful cottages offering great view. Sauna offer great relaxing experience. One of the finest resort for calming and relaxing experience. Chef offered great South Indian as well north Indian cuisine with flavors of Kerala.

We celebrated our son's first birthday there.
A calm, peaceful place with a mind-blowing view.
Needed a fruit-born cake (when searched for a place we asked everyone for cake but no one was ready, but here in first call itself they said yes and it was above our expectations thanks to shef).
Staffs were extremely nice.Food was very good.we can order as we want.Swimming pool - baby friendly ‚ô•Ô∏è with an awesome view. View from cottage is mind-blowing. Had sessions of Morning yogaü•∞ and evening activities.
A break time spend well üíï
Thanks to shefs special cake

Summary up front:
We stayed for a week, and leaving felt like saying goodbye to family. Front office staff, restaurant folks, Ayurvedic center team, gardeners, and the resort manager all came together to plant a tree with us (photo below) and then waved until our cab drove out of the gates. That moment sums up the heart of this place.

1. The property (location, rooms, atmosphere)
This resort is something else. It sits on slightly elevated land right at the Arabian Sea, built in classical South Indian architecture but with all the modern comforts you‚Äôd want. We went in August during the monsoons‚Äîlush greenery everywhere, waves crashing just beyond the cottages. Within a day you forget time and place and just melt into nature‚Äôs calm. Pure bliss.

2. Food and the team
The food is fantastic, but it‚Äôs the people who make it special. Everyone is so warm and polite, always going out of their way to make you comfortable. The chefs spoiled us‚Äînot just with what was on the menu (which was already excellent), but by cooking up little off-menu dishes for our girls. My wife fell in love with their filter coffee made with jaggery and coconut milk. When we tried and failed to find that jaggery in the local market, the chef actually arranged some and sent a kilo to our room the next day. That‚Äôs the level of care here.

The resort manager, Ameya, runs the place beautifully‚Äîlike a homestay that‚Äôs cozy and personal, but with the professionalism of a top resort. He‚Äôs always around, talking to guests, giving advice, sharing stories. Meals here were a highlight: fresh, tasty, served with love, and often enjoyed with sea breeze (or rain) in the background. Easily some of our best memories.

3. Ayurvedic center & yoga
We both did consultations and massages, and the doctors really took their time‚Äîlistening, explaining, suggesting long-term lifestyle tips. The therapists were excellent too. Honestly, if you‚Äôre coming for Ayurveda, stay at least a week (two if you can).

Yoga was another gem. Classes moved indoors when it rained, but otherwise they were held by the sea each morning. I skipped (and regret it), but my wife went daily. The instructor, Mr. Unni, is such a gentle, wise soul. He didn‚Äôt just teach yoga but shared life stories, tailored advice, and treated each guest like a friend.

Final thoughts
This isn‚Äôt just a place to stay‚Äîit‚Äôs a place to reconnect with yourself and with nature. If you want to slow down, heal, and recharge, I can‚Äôt recommend it enough.

In olden days Portuguese and Dutch had commercial establishments here and Portuguese have built a church near to sea shore, referred to as Old Vizhinjam Church.

reviews.reviewText:
The Leela Kovalam is an ultra luxurious and breathtaking property that captures the heart, the moment you step foot here! Located on a stunning hill, it offers direct up close and personal views of the Arabian Sea in all its glory. The benches placed at strategic locations all across the property are a definite win-win and offer perfect photo-ops!

Other than unforgettable views and a premium feel, the hotel offers an extremely memorable stay with warm interiors and cosy comfort.

At the time of checkin we were upgraded to a premium sea view room which was a huge plus and much appreciated. Their breakfast buffet had a good selection of items. We tried their chicken biryani for dinner and it was a winner too!!

A special mention goes out to ms. Hema and Akansha at the reception for their personalised attention.

Easily one of the most picturesque hotels I have been to. Right next to the Arabian sea, the hotel offers awesome views. Premium Seaview Rooms or the Club Rooms have the best views.

The property is well maintained with lots of places to take a walk. There are places to sit & enjoy the waves crashing into the beach.

A visit to the Tides beach side restaurant is a must.

The service is exceptional with staff always smiling & helpful.

Awesome location and service. Breakfast was superb but dinner was quite disappointing, though the spread was great the taste was questionable. Not sure if different chefs handle the different times.

Rooms can definitely improve. Quite cramped for the price paid, though the view was to die for. Definitely not toddler friendly. The rooms have a couple of stairs that cannot be blocked plus the bathroom door does not lock from the outside which is a nightmare with a toddler. The bathroom floors are extremely slippery and my baby did have a bad fall too. Luckily nothing grave happened. All the complimentary toiletries and tea spread are literally hidden away in the never ending drawers and it is quite a treasure hunt. Even the refrigerator is locked and opened only on request.

All the staff were exceptional and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. They were especially sweet to our baby and even sent us home with soft toys for the kiddo. Special mention to ‚ÄúMitali‚Äù who helped us with a last minute birthday surprise and made the stay all the more special.

A Slice of Paradise by the Sea
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

We had an absolutely wonderful experience staying at Leela ,Kovalam:a breathtaking property! From the moment we arrived, the staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome.Our room was beautifully done up making us feel at home .
An impressive spread at the restaurant as well.

A big thanks to each & every member who made our stay extra special with their warm smiles & hospitality.

Excellent Stay, breathtaking spot ,lovely people ‚Äì Highly Recommended!

The Leela Kovalam is pure luxury by the sea! Perched on a stunning cliff with panoramic views of the Arabian Sea, it offers one of the most breathtaking settings in Kerala. The rooms are spacious, beautifully maintained, and designed to capture the charm of the coastline. The infinity pool overlooking the ocean is simply magical, especially at sunset. The food is exceptional, with a mix of authentic Kerala flavors and global cuisine, all served with elegance. What truly elevates the experience is the staff ‚Äî warm, professional, and attentive to every detail, making you feel pampered throughout your stay. From the serene spa to the private beach access, everything here is about comfort, beauty, and world-class hospitality. A must-visit for anyone seeking a memorable coastal getaway!

For Excellent Service:

"The staff was incredibly welcoming and went out of their way to make our stay comfortable."

"Exceptional hospitality! Everyone was warm, polite, and always ready to help."

"The bed was super comfortable, and the room had a calming vibe‚Äîperfect for relaxing."

Best Resort I have been to hands-down. Ambience is unparalleled and superb. We were a group of 12 and had booked 5 rooms. Got upgraded to Club Room with an uninterrupted sea view and with waves lashing on to rocks at the base of the Club room.
What sets this resort apart is the ambience and the excellent customer service from every staff in the hotel. Butler was very very helpful and made sure that elderly parents who needed wheelchair support are well taken care of and mobility does not impact them. Housekeeping staff always took care of anything needed super promptly and so did the front desk. Hats off to the managers and the. entire staff for creating such a welcoming atmosphere and for going out of their way to make it comfortable for their guests. Truly appreciate the staff.
Food was awesome and so were the entire staff in the restaurant. The Chef checked with us what we would like to have for breakfast the previous evening and made Mutton stew for us despite that not being on the breakfast menu and included couple of other items in the breakfast buffet menu based on our request. Don't miss the filter coffee, Kerala tea, dosas, uzhunnu vada and puris for breakfast. Lovely ambience, lovely resort, lovely food and lovely staff!! We will be back for sure üòä

I have stayed at many hotels in India, but this was truly the most beautiful place I have ever seen. The Leela Hotel was shining with its great name and reputation. The design of the hotel is a perfect mix of tradition and modern style. Nature and technology come together in a very peaceful and beautiful way.

The Leela Kovalam is in the best location near the beach. The sea, the trees, and the wind create a calm and relaxing feeling. I especially want to recommend the sunset swimming experience. I don‚Äôt know who designed it, but the height of the pool and the sea level match so well. You can enjoy the most amazing sunset while swimming. It was the best moment of my whole trip in India.

All the staff were very kind and helpful. They treated us with great care and respect. The food was excellent. The bed, pillows, and mattress were so soft and comfortable.  I felt like I was sleeping on a cloud! There was also a special smell in the room that made it feel even more relaxing. I already miss it so much.

One more thing! I left something very important in the room by mistake. The hotel manager and staff helped me a lot. I want to thank Shahna Ma‚Äôam especially. She helped me find my lost item, and I am really grateful for her help.

If you visit Kerala, I strongly recommend staying at The Leela Hotel. You will have one of the best experiences of your life.

reviews.reviewText: It's an excellent Heritage Hotel located at an elevated place with an excellent view of the sea. The property is very well maintained. All the rooms are outstanding and are spread in the area. EV Cart is provided for commuting within the premises. The food and service are superb. There are two swimming pools and a private Beach with Lifeguards.

Excellent property with lovely views. Rooms could be maintained a little better (they are dated) but the location and views made up for it. Food at dinner time was delicious, and breakfast had plenty of vegetarian options and was adequate. Beach access is not direct, it requires a bit of a walk outside the property through public roads although at the beach there are sun beds and towels provided, and the beach itself is very beautiful and clean (swimming not advisable). Plenty of area to walk around, lots of hammocks etc and activities such as pottery are available. Staff were all very friendly and accommodating.

A Relaxing Family Retreat with a Few Areas for Improvement

We enjoyed our first family stay at Travancore and overall it was a peaceful and rejuvenating experience‚Äîperfect for a short getaway with both elderly family members and a toddler.

We stayed in the Heritage Rooms 4 & 5, which were spacious, clean, and well-equipped with all the essential amenities. The rooms had a charming traditional feel and were comfortably laid out to accommodate our family's needs. One of the highlights was the private swing just outside the room, overlooking a beautifully maintained garden with a hammock that added to the relaxing atmosphere.

A short walk from our rooms led us to a quaint tea stall with views of the beach. While it was a bit of a trek to reach the beach, the setting made it worthwhile. The food at the resort was quite good, offering a decent variety of vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes. However, we felt it would have been even better with more authentic local Kerala cuisine options to truly elevate the dining experience.

That said, there are a few areas where the resort could improve. The bathrooms were not soundproof, and we could clearly hear our neighbors‚Äô conversations, which took away from the tranquility during moments like a relaxing shower. Also, the walk to the rooms was quite long and dark and we often had to wait a considerable time for the buggy service. Transportation is a challenge here‚Äîthere are no nearby transport options, and external car services appear to be monopolised, making them quite pricey.

Despite these points, the ambiance, hospitality and overall feel of the resort make it a place we‚Äôd definitely consider returning to‚Äîespecially for special occasions or a quiet, relaxing escape. We do hope for improvements in transport convenience and more competitive pricing, but with a good deal or discount, it‚Äôs certainly worth another stay.

We stayed for three Nights in this property. It‚Äôs a beautiful property for all type of people. Great location with wonderful ambiance. Rooms are spacious with all four star amenities. We enjoyed the swimming pool and the Garden areas, all in top quality . All staff was well mannered, polite and too much careful about the guests. Sea beach within walking distance. It‚Äôs an unimaginable big property with full of flowers and absolute greenery. Food is lovable with variety for everyone. In a short this is an excellent hotel. Recommend for all. Thank you very much to make our stay memorable.

Excellent property and ambiance, close to the beach with private access. Buffet is below average, but √† la carte items were good, especially seafood. Reception is good and room service is timely. However, there were frequent power cuts, and backup takes up to a minute to restore. Water bottle delivery by housekeeping is very slow. Overall, a very good experience with scope for improvement.

This is the most delightful hotel. Lovely welcome, exceptional staff who are friendly and helpful. Everyone greets you from the gardens to house cleaner‚Äôs restaurant and reception. EVERYONE is wonderful. The rooms are comfortable and well serviced. Lovely variety of food and the treatments were beautiful. I cannot rate this facility highly enough! I‚Äôll be back
Located very close to the beach. In fact the resort has a private access to the beach. Rooms are spacious, traditional styled rooms. Food was good as well. Definitely recommended

Uday Samudra is a beautiful hotel offering all the comforts expected from a 5-star property. Our pool-facing room was spacious, and the extra bed arranged for our son was surprisingly comfortable. The hotel boasts three pools, which made up for the fact that the private beach was a letdown ‚Äî quite rocky and closed due to high tide. If you're visiting in June, July, or August, be prepared for limited beach access.

The kitchen shuts at 3 PM, which caught us off guard, leaving us to settle for snacks instead of a proper lunch. While tasty, the portion sizes could be more generous. On the plus side, the bar has a happy hour starting at 7 PM, and the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful throughout our stay.

Ideal for a relaxing poolside break, but check beach conditions if that‚Äôs a priority.

‚≠êÔ∏è Relaxing Stay at UDS Kovalam ‚Äì Great Food & Beautiful Ambience ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

We visited UDS Kovalam last month, and it was a wonderful experience! The sea frontage and lush greenery made the whole atmosphere peaceful and refreshing. The ambience is lovely, and the resort is very well maintained.

Usually, I take a full room and property tour, but this time was all about slowing down, mindfulness, and simply enjoying the moment ‚Äî and UDS was the perfect place for that.

The food was delicious, with plenty of variety, and the staff were polite, helpful, and made us feel truly welcome. Our kids especially enjoyed the swimming pool ‚Äî a perfect place for a family break.

Highly recommended for any
one looking to relax by the beach with good food, great service, and a calm, scenic vibe.

reviews.reviewText: We stayed at the hotel as a family. It's a beautiful place to spend some quality time. The have a beautiful pool close to the dining hall. Everything in the hotel has been tastefully done and gives one a feel of having arrived at Kerala. Very traditional setup but exquisitely elegant. Moreover it very close to the airport too. Perfect place for anyone looking to stay close to the Trivandrum airport.

We had a wonderful family holiday at Uday Suites, and it truly exceeded our expectations. The hospitality was warm and welcoming ‚Äî every member of the staff was attentive, polite, and went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. The food was absolutely mouthwatering, with a delightful range at breakfast, lunch, and dinner that catered to all tastes. The hotel‚Äôs facilities were equally impressive ‚Äî from clean, spacious rooms to the lovely pool and serene surroundings, everything was thoughtfully maintained. Uday Suites is an ideal place for a relaxing vacation, and we‚Äôd happily return!

Great place for a family / friends get-together. The staff were so courteous and were attentive all the time. We had a cake cutting ceremony for our young kid and they arranged the cake for a cost. The cakes were yummy. We went there for a buffet dinner, and it was decently priced (Ra.899 + GST). They had 8 veg dishes and 4 non-veg dishes + 5-6 types of deserts. The Restaurant Manager Abin was so courteous and polite and made all arrangements for us over a phone call. Great service!

I recently had the opportunity to visit this beach resort for my engagement function, and it was a wonderful experience. The venue was clean, well-maintained, and provided a beautiful setting for the event. The overall ambiance was peaceful and inviting, which added to the joy of the occasion.

We hosted a family event at Uday Suites Marigold hall. The staff behavior is worrh mentioning. Thanks to Nithin for his professional and humble customer service. All other staff were also very cooperative.
The food is just wow. We feel very happy to have found this place to host our event.

Had a fantastic stay at Uday Suites! The hotel‚Äôs lush greenery and serene atmosphere make it feel like a peaceful retreat, even though it‚Äôs so close to the airport. The pool area is gorgeous, and the overall vibe is perfect for both relaxation and convenience. The staff was friendly and attentive, making sure all our needs were met. Highly recommend it for anyone visiting Trivandrum‚Äîwhether for business or leisure!

Tried the dinner buffet recently‚Äîwhile the ambience was truly impressive and made for a pleasant evening, the food itself was just okay. The variety was quite limited, especially considering the price, and we expected more in terms of options and taste. Overall, not the best value if you're going mainly for the food. Wouldn't recommend it for the buffet menu alone.

The hotel is perfectly situated near by the Shanghumugam Beach. It's also within walking distance.

Guests have praised the hotel's rooms for being comfortable, clean, and well-appointed, with amenities like big desks, multiple plug points, and free mineral water. Some rooms have beautiful bathrooms and gorgeous swimming pool views.

The hotel's restaurants have received praise for serving delicious food in a lovely setting.

The hotel staff have been consistently described as friendly, helpful.

It has free wifi, shared pool, and plenty of parking, a lift,and  a  lovely staircase.

reviews.reviewText: My stay at Hotel Sagara was really good. The location is excellent, just a few steps from the beach. The room was clean and had a nice view of the sea. Staff were polite and helpful throughout. I liked the pool area‚Äîit was quiet and relaxing. The food was average, but the overall experience was comfortable and worth it.

People are nice there and bit supportive too.
But honestly they need to improve both service timings and food.
Since it was resort, located at nice place our expectations were bit more.
room condition also needs improvement as water pressure in shower and flush were so slow. amenities too were bit less.
Food taste was below average and 1 time we too felt one item stale.
I am sure if they improve these few things then this resort will become one stop fun for holidays for many people.
But till then i would say its slightly below average.

I had a pleasant stay at Hotel Sagara in Kovalam. The best part was its location‚Äîjust a short walk to the beach, and the sea view from my room was really beautiful. The room itself was clean, spacious, and comfortable. The staff were friendly and always ready to help, which made the stay even better. I enjoyed relaxing by the pool in the evenings, and the overall atmosphere of the hotel was peaceful and perfect for a break. The food was okay‚Äînothing fancy, but it did the job. Overall, it was a comfortable and enjoyable experience, and I‚Äôd definitely consider staying here again.

I stayed at Hotel Sagara for two nights and had a nice experience. The room was spacious and tidy, with a lovely sea view. The staff were courteous and quick to respond. The hotel is very close to the beach, which was super convenient. Overall, it‚Äôs a peaceful place to relax and enjoy the coast.

We had a pleasant stay at the property. The rooms are nice, and the location is convenient. Food service was prompt and satisfactory. However, housekeeping services need improvement.

We stayed for four days, during which a cyclone occurred, causing some damage. Unfortunately, despite multiple reminders, the basic debris was not cleared. A metal rod even fell onto our balcony from the floor above. While someone did come to remove the rod after we reported it, smaller cement debris was left uncleared throughout our stay

Our family stayed at this property for two nights and we truly had a memorable stay! The property is in a wonderful location, is maintained well and is having a very caring and helpful staff! We are particularly pleased with the care and support received from the Operations Manager Mr. Immanuel during and after our stay! We had left my son's pet toy in the room. Though we contacted only after 5 days of checking out, Mr. Immanuel arranged to courier back the toy!

On the first day we were in room number 1004 which was quite nice room with swimming pool view and partial sea view. Later on next day we were shifted to room number 2007 which was the room on the floor of reception, there was clear Sea view but the room had old bathroom which had dirty wash basin tap. other issues like hot water issue, fan  not working.
So overall it was ok stay which is not justified for a price of 4000/- per day.

We stayed for 2 nights. There was a private party near the swimming pool, loud music was played from 7 pm, decibels crossed the danger level, windows vibrated,our peaceful holiday shattered with every beat played by the DJ. Repeated calls to the reception to lower the sound fell on deaf ears( probably already damaged hearing apparatus from high decibels). Please reconsider if you have family with you or you think you deserve peace on a  vacation.

reviews.reviewText: Just got back from a trip here and it was excellent! We arrived 4hrs before checkin. Not only did the staff accommodate us but they also let us switch our complimentary breakfast from the next morning with the day of arrival. The rooms were clean with all amenities, a balcony that opens to the sea. Great location, well maintained pool and restaurant and decent breakfast spread. But the service takes the cake. Everyone from reception to pool boy was excellent. The watchman gave us restaurant recommendations. The pool boy got us some neat shots. The restaurant staff gave us very helpful tips for sight seeing. Loved every minute of the stay! Will come back definitely. 10/10 would recommend.

I stayed at "Soma plam shore" for 2 nights, and it was a great experience. The check-in process was smooth, the staff were very courteous, and the room had everything I needed ‚Äî clean bed, good lighting, and a hygienic bathroom. The breakfast buffet was delicious and had many options. Overall, a peaceful and relaxing stay. Highly recommended!

‚ÄúExcellent location, but disappointing stay experience.‚Äù

The resort is blessed with a fantastic beachfront location at Kovalam, offering beautiful sea views and a peaceful setting. Unfortunately, the overall stay was not up to expectations.

‚ö†Ô∏è Concerns noticed:

Rooms were poorly maintained ‚Äî damp smell, visible fungal stains, and an overall dingy feel.

Food quality was below average and lacked freshness.

Basic upkeep and hygiene standards need significant improvement.

‚úÖ Positives:

Beach access and location are excellent.

Outdoor areas and pool have potential if better maintained.

üåø Overall Impression:
While the property has an enviable location, the maintenance, food quality, and room conditions urgently need attention. With proper care, this resort could truly match its setting.

I truly believe we got way more than our money‚Äôs worth at Soma Palmshore! I booked a family stay for 9 individuals (4 adults, 5 children), and we stayed for vacation. I couldn‚Äôt have been more pleased. The rooms were spacious, well-furnished, and really very comfortable and clean. Balconies overlooking the beach, perfect temperature control, space to unpack everything we brought, and more‚Ä¶ the rooms we were given provided everything we could have hoped for and more. Most exceptional of all, however, was the staff. Every staff member - from reception, to waiters, to parking lot attendants, to the lifeguard were kind, warm, professional, and always eager to help with every little thing. Each staff member always had a welcoming smile on their face. The location couldn‚Äôt have been better, as we could walk to Lighthouse Beach easily. I will now be looking for reasons to return to Kovalam for the purpose of staying at Soma Palmshore Resort. Oh, and I should probably mention, the food is great, too! üëç

reviews.reviewText: Had a great experience in Stay@home with my family of 8 members. Rooms are very clean and well maintained, also it's looks exactly as in the image. Dear fellow travelers,

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Renjith's property and wanted to share my experience with you. First of all, I must say that Renjith is an excellent host who always checked in to make sure we were comfortable and had everything we needed. He truly went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable.

The house itself is quite old, but Renjith has done a fantastic job of maintaining it and providing all the necessary facilities. The bedrooms are on the small side, but they are comfortable and functional. The location of the house is also great, as it is accessible to all the major attractions and not too far from the city center. The road leading to the property is big enough and not congested, making it easy to get in and out.

All the amenities in the house were in good working order and served our purpose well. The only issue we had was with the air conditioning, which was of poor quality and didn't cool the room as well as we would have liked.

Despite this minor inconvenience, I would highly recommend this property to anyone looking for a comfortable and convenient place to stay. Renjith is truly a superhost and deserves all the kudos he can get. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

The house was really beautiful with an amazing courtyard. It was located near to most of the touristy places in Trivandrum and also from the airport so that was a huge advantage for us. Overall a beautiful home to stay in with family and friends.

placeMetadata.name: Shangumugham Beach
placeMetadata.description: This sandy stretch of coastline for recreation hosts a ceremonial procession honoring Hindu deities.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Shangumugham Beach, located near the city airport, is a stunning destination with clear waters and pristine white sand. It is celebrated for its unspoiled beauty and cleanliness, making it one of the most picturesque spots in the area. This popular beach attracts both locals and tourists who come to relax and admire the serene atmosphere along the Arabian Sea. Visitors can enjoy breathtaking sunsets, indulge in beach activities like kite flying, and savor local street food from nearby stalls.
placeMetadata.address: Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India

reviews.reviewText:
I visited Shangumugham beach in the early morning for a walk. It was beautiful to enjoy the sea shore. The sound of waves, cool breeze and less crowded in the early morning felt amazing.

You can enjoy great views of sea shore on both the sides. It's a long coastal area.

It's a tourist attraction that needs a lot of improvement. The beach is very dirty. The walkway is also not built and maintained properly. The entire area needs to be cleaned properly. There is a lot of scope for this place to become a hot tourist spot.

A peaceful beach to enjoy the sunset. The view is really beautiful, especially in the evening. There‚Äôs a big mermaid statue and plenty of space to walk or relax. Some areas need a bit of cleaning, but overall it‚Äôs a nice spot to chill with friends or family. Close to the airport too. üåäüåÖ

Visited Shanmugham Beach on a sunny day around midday, and it was really hot. But the calming wind gave a lot of relief and made the weather bearable. Went there also to use the public toilet‚Äîit was surprisingly clean and well-maintained. Took some nice pictures and enjoyed the peaceful vibes despite the heat. Overall, it was a refreshing experience and a nice spot to relax for a while. Would definitely visit again, maybe during evening hours for a cooler breeze and sunset views.

A Scenic Beach with Unique Attractions!
Shangumugham Beach is one of the most beautiful beaches in Kerala, offering a serene coastal vibe right near the heart of the city. A massive mermaid sculpture, an iconic piece of art, welcomes you at the entrance, making it a popular photo spot. There's also a helicopter installation placed nearby, which adds to the attraction and catches the attention of tourists.

I visited the beach at the end of May, during the onset of the monsoon season. Due to heavy rainfall, it wasn‚Äôt an ideal time to explore or enjoy the beach fully. I recommend planning your visit during the dry season for the best experience.

Shangumugham Beach, once a bustling, sandy escape, now stands as a stark reminder of Kerala‚Äôs changing coastline. It‚Äôs especially crowded on Sundays‚Äîbut much of the original beach, along with pathways and benches, has been swallowed by relentless sea erosion in recent years. With new coastal projects like Adani‚Äôs underway, the landscape here is set to transform even more dramatically in the next decade, making today‚Äôs sunsets at the shore unique and precious moments. So, visit soon: soak in the vibrant sunset, tread carefully around the water, and make the most of what‚Äôs left of this Thiruvananthapuram icon before it changes forever. PRO tip‚Äîskip the pista flavor at the Amul shop on the premises!

A piece of advice for fellow travelers: cherish this living memory while you can, as Shangumugham Beach is on the brink of becoming part of Kerala‚Äôs coastal history.

I recently visited Shanghumukham Beach in Trivandrum, and I must say it was one of the most peaceful and refreshing experiences I‚Äôve had in a while. The beach has a calm, relaxed vibe that instantly makes you feel at ease. It's perfect for a quiet walk, watching the waves, or just sitting and enjoying the sea breeze.

The beach is wide and open, giving you plenty of space to sit or walk without feeling crowded. I went in the evening, and the sunset view was absolutely stunning ‚Äì the sky turned a beautiful mix of orange and pink as the sun dipped below the horizon. It‚Äôs a perfect spot for photography lovers and anyone who enjoys nature at its best.

One of the highlights of this beach is the huge mermaid sculpture (Sagarakanyaka), which is not only impressive but also adds an artistic and cultural charm to the place. It‚Äôs a unique landmark that you won‚Äôt find at other beaches.

Even though it's close to the city, it doesn‚Äôt feel chaotic. There were families, couples, and tourists ‚Äì but the atmosphere was still peaceful. It‚Äôs also a place of spiritual and cultural importance, especially during certain Hindu festivals when rituals are performed here.

There are a few snack stalls and tea vendors nearby, so you can enjoy a cup of tea or a local bite while watching the waves. The breeze, the sound of the sea, and the open sky make it a great place to unwind.

If you're in Trivandrum and want to experience a blend of natural beauty, culture, and calmness, Shanghumukham Beach is a must-visit. I‚Äôd definitely love to go back again.

recently visited Shankhumugham Beach in Thiruvananthapuram, and it was an incredible experience. The beach is truly beautiful, offering stunning views, especially in the evening. As the sun begins to set, the entire place transforms into a serene and mesmerizing scene‚Äîperfect for a peaceful walk or just soaking in the natural beauty. A must-visit spot if you're in the area!

placeMetadata.name: Azhimala Cliff and Beach
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Azhimala Cliff and Beach is a must-visit destination for nature enthusiasts and devotees in Kerala. It offers a peaceful and serene atmosphere, making it even more appealing than Kovalam beach. The beach is pristine and not crowded, providing a tranquil experience for visitors. Accessing the beach can be challenging, but parking is available near the nearby temple.
placeMetadata.address: Azhimala Temple Road, Adimalathura, Kazhivoor, Kottukal, Kerala 695521, India

reviews.reviewText:
Azhimala Cliff and Beach is a beautiful, spacious location perfect for enjoying a relaxing day by the sea.

The beach offers plenty of space for visitors to unwind, soak in the sun, and enjoy the natural beauty.

The area features several restaurants serving local delicacies, along with shops where you can purchase souvenirs.

Nearby, there are resorts that offer a comfortable stay, making it a great destination for a short getaway.

Azhimala Beach is also conveniently close to Kovalam Beach, allowing visitors to easily explore both scenic spots.

Azhimala Shiva Temple, located near Kovalam in Kerala, is a breathtaking spiritual destination that beautifully blends devotion with scenic beauty. Nestled atop a cliff overlooking the Arabian Sea, the temple offers a mesmerizing view, especially during sunrise and sunset. The towering 58-ft Shiva statue, intricately carved and exuding divine energy, is the main highlight. The craftsmanship and detailing in the statue make it a marvel to behold.

The serene ambiance, coupled with the soothing sea breeze, creates a perfect setting for meditation and reflection. The temple premises are well-maintained, and the surrounding greenery adds to its charm. Visitors can also enjoy the nearby Azhimala Beach, known for its rugged coastline and stunning waves. Whether you seek spiritual solace or simply want to admire the architectural wonder, Azhimala Temple is a must-visit. My experience here in December 2024 was truly unforgettable, leaving me with a deep sense of peace and reverence.

Azhimala Cliff and Beach is a serene coastal escape located in Adimalathura, near Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala. This picturesque spot offers breathtaking views of the Arabian Sea from the cliff and a peaceful beach that's perfect for relaxation. The beach is clean, relatively uncrowded, and surrounded by lush greenery, making it an ideal getaway for those looking to enjoy nature. A highlight is the nearby Azhimala Shiva Temple, featuring a striking 58-ft tall statue of Lord Shiva, adding a spiritual touch to the experience.

Visitors can enjoy a leisurely walk along the cliff, sunbathe on the beach, or simply take in the stunning coastal views. The beach's calm atmosphere makes it a hidden gem compared to more crowded spots like Kovalam.

This place is highly recommended for those seeking peace, scenic beauty, and a bit of adventure, but be prepared for a bit of walking, as accessing the beach involves descending some steps.

Azhimala Shiva Temple, located in the coastal village of Azhimala near Kovalam in Kerala, is a revered Hindu shrine dedicated to Lord Shiva. Perched on a rocky cliff overlooking the Arabian Sea, the temple is famous for its breathtaking ocean views and serene ambiance. The highlight of the temple is the massive 58-foot-tall statue of Lord Shiva, one of the tallest in South India. This intricately sculpted statue, depicting Shiva in a meditative yet fierce posture with flowing hair, has become a major attraction for devotees and tourists alike.

The temple's name, "Azhimala," means "mountain by the sea," aptly describing its stunning location. Devotees flock to the temple, especially on Mondays and during Maha Shivaratri, to seek blessings and witness the spiritual grandeur of the place.

Just below the temple lies Azhimala Beach, a pristine and lesser-known coastal paradise. The beach is famous for its golden sands, rocky outcrops, and mesmerizing sunsets. Unlike the more commercialized beaches in Kerala, Azhimala Beach retains a peaceful and untouched charm, making it perfect for relaxation and photography.

Together, Azhimala Shiva Temple and Beach offer a unique blend of spirituality and natural beauty, making it a must-visit destination in Kerala.
Beautiful place to visit in evening the beaches and the Siva statue gives a very natural feeling with the sea breeze hitting you there. Just visit here once.

Breathtaking Views, Heart-Pounding Experience

Rating: 5/5

I have visited the cliff at Azhimala several times and was left awestruck by its sheer scale and natural beauty. The moment I stepped near the edge, I felt a rush of adrenaline and a sense of wonder. The vast expanse of the landscape unfolded before me, with the wind whipping my hair and the sun casting a golden glow over the scenery.

The cliff's rugged texture and dramatic drop-off made for a thrilling experience, and I found myself feeling both terrified and exhilarated at the same time. The views were simply stunning, with the distant horizon stretching out as far as the eye could see.

If you're looking for a unique and unforgettable experience, I highly recommend visiting this cliff. Just be sure to exercise caution and respect the natural environment.

*Pros:*

- Breathtaking views
- Thrilling experience
- Unique natural wonder

*Cons:*

- Can be dangerous if not approached with caution
- Weather conditions can affect visibility and safety

Overall, I would highly recommend this cliff to anyone seeking an adventure or a chance to connect with nature's raw power.
Apart from the majestic Shiva statue‚Ä¶ the stunning cliff view with light surroundings of ponds and the mesmerising Arabian Sea being swept of our feet..!

The beach at Azhimala is incredibly beautiful and well-maintained. It's an ideal spot to spend your evening with your family, offering a stunning sunset view. Additionally, you can visit the nearby Siva temple, which houses one of the largest statues of Lord Shiva. To access the statue area, you'll need to purchase tickets, which cost around 20 to 30 Rs per person.

ops.insert: Rocky shoreline next to a busy historic port, with village views plus a fish market & nearby church.

Kovalam is a small coastal town in the southern Indian state of Kerala, south of Thiruvananthapuram. At the southern end of Lighthouse Beach is a striped lighthouse with a viewing platform. Palm-backed beaches also include Hawa Beach and Samudra Beach. Heading south, Vizhinjam Juma Masjid mosque overlooks the busy fishing harbor. Inland, Sagarika Marine Research Aquarium displays technology used in pearl production.
Picturesque beach providing canal views, sculptures, boat rides, a charming church & garden area.

Thiruvananthapuram (or Trivandrum) is the capital of the southern Indian state of Kerala. It's distinguished by its British colonial architecture and many art galleries. It‚Äôs also home to Kuthira Malika (or Puthen Malika) Palace, adorned with carved horses and displaying collections related to the Travancore royal family, whose regional capital was here from the 18th‚Äì20th centuries.

Vizhinjam is an area located in the city of Thiruvananthapuram, the capital city of the state of Kerala in India. which belongs to Thiruvananthapuram Corporation. It is located 16 km south west from the city centre and 17 km south of Trivandrum International Airport along NH66. Wikipedia.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we‚Äôre always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Nestled along the stunning coastline of Kerala, Thiruvananthapuram, or Trivandrum, is a treasure trove of beautiful beaches that beckon travelers seeking sun, sand, and serenity. From the iconic Kovalam Beach, with its towering lighthouse and vibrant atmosphere, to the tranquil shores of Puthenthope Beach, this region offers a diverse array of coastal experiences. Whether you're looking to unwind on a palm-fringed stretch of sand or explore the local culture at bustling fishing harbors, the beaches here promise unforgettable moments and breathtaking views.

As you wander along the coastline, you'll discover a mix of well-known spots and hidden gems, each with its own unique charm. Picture yourself lounging at the luxurious Niraamaya Retreats Surya Samudra or enjoying a laid-back afternoon at the Pappukutty Beach Resort. With options ranging from lively beach parks to serene retreats, the beaches around Thiruvananthapuram cater to every type of traveler. So grab your sunscreen and get ready to explore the stunning coastal beauty that awaits you in this enchanting part of India.

placeMetadata.name: Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple

sources.snippet: The most important remnant of the past and a significant landmark of Trivandrum City is undoubtedly the Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple built by King Marthanda Varma of the Travancore Royal Family in 1745. Dedicated to Lord Vishnu it is one of the oldest, most popular, and wealthiest temples in India. This is one of the main landmarks in Trivandrum.
sources.shortName: Historical landmarks in Trivandrum

sources.snippet: The temple is a beautiful example of Dravidian architecture featuring a gopuram. Dedicated to the Lord Vishnu, followers of Hinduism visit the temple throughout the year. Plated in gold, it has a ubiquitous presence of stone carvings and murals.
sources.shortName: Places to visit in Trivandrum for the Travelling Architect - RTF

sources.snippet: Padmanabhaswamy Temple is a significant Hindu temple dedicated to Vishnu. Located in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, this temple is known for its impressive architecture. It combines Kerala and Dravidian styles, featuring a 100-foot tall gopuram.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Architectural Buildings in Thiruvananthapuram, India: A Cultural and Historical Tour ‚Äì Engineers and Architects of America

placeMetadata.description: 1729 temple complex, known for its towering gateway and shrine to Padmanabha reclining on a serpent.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple is a prominent feature of Thiruvananthapuram, part of a temple complex with a towering gateway and shrine to Padmanabha reclining on a serpent. The city also boasts other attractions like the Keralan Museum, Napier Museum, Kerala Government Secretariat, and various palaces and historical sites.
placeMetadata.address: West Nada, Fort, East Fort, Pazhavangadi, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695023, India

reviews.reviewText:
Visiting sacred Sree Padmanabhaswamy temple is a  complete bliss!!!
One of the oldest and richest shrines of Lord Vishnu, one can witness the lord in anantashyana posture through three doors of this temple. The architecture, divine energy and rich Kerala tradition well witnessed in this sacred place.

Tips for a pleasant visit:
1. Strict dress code to be followed by devotees ( traditional dress for women and only dhoti with towel for men) Shirt and T-shirts are not allowed
2. Temple dharshan timings are quite different from other temples....plan accordingly
3. Early morning Dharshan is less crowded, otherwise there is a waiting period of 1-2 hours as per crowd
4. Special VIP dharshan tickets are available only in-person inside the temple
5. Cloak rooms are available to keep valuable and cloth
6. It is nice to visit the nearby Ganesha temple along with it
7. There are four gates to enter, the east gate is more crowded.

Have recently visited and was deeply moved by the serene atmosphere and beautiful architecture. The intricate carvings and stunning deities created a sense of tranquility, allowing me to connect with my spirituality. The priests were warm and welcoming, offering insightful guidance and blessings. The community's dedication to preserving traditions and serving devotees is truly commendable. I felt a deep sense of peace and gratitude during my visit. Highly recommended for those seeking spiritual growth and connection.
Security is a bit high compared to any other religious places which may due to the wealthy nature of deity

I visited the temple during the weekend on a Saturday in July month. Instantly fell in love with the atmosphere and calmness inside and around the temple. Sri Padmanabhaswamy Temple in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, is a revered Hindu shrine dedicated to Lord Vishnu, depicted in a reclining posture on the serpent Anantha. Renowned for its Dravidian architecture and spiritual significance, the temple is one of the 108 Divya Desams dedicated to Vishnu. The temple's main deity is composed of 12,008 saligrams, fossilized shells from the Gandaki River in Nepal, and is preserved using a unique Ayurvedic mixture called "Katusarkara yogam" .

The temple is also famous for its treasure vaults, which were discovered to contain immense wealth, including gold, jewels, and artifacts, making it one of the richest temples in the world . In June 2025, the temple hosted a rare Maha Kumbhabhishekam, a consecration ritual conducted after nearly 270 years, marking a significant event in its history .

Visitors are required to adhere to a strict dress code: men must wear a white dhoti with an angavastram, and women should wear a sari. Entry is permitted only to Hindus, as per the Temple Entry Proclamation . The temple opens for darshan at 3:15 am and closes at 7:20 pm, with various slots for prayers and rituals throughout the day .

While the temple offers a profound spiritual experience, some visitors have reported issues such as overcrowding and lack of proper guidance for tourists . Additionally, the temple's treasure vaults have been a subject of legal and spiritual debates, adding to its mystique and intrigue .

Overall, Sri Padmanabhaswamy Temple stands as a testament to Kerala's rich cultural and spiritual heritage, offering visitors a glimpse into the region's deep-rooted traditions and beliefs.

Napier Museum is a meticulously organized and captivating venue that highlights India's extensive cultural legacy. With a wealth of exhibits to explore, it offers a truly enriching experience. One cannot help but feel immense pride in witnessing the advanced knowledge and creativity of our forebears. "I recently had the pleasure of visiting the Napier Museum in Trivandrum and was thoroughly impressed. The museum is a beautiful example of Indo-Saracenic architecture, and its stunning red and white exterior is a sight to behold.

Inside, the collection is a fascinating journey through Kerala's rich history and culture. The bronze sculptures, ancient musical instruments, and intricate ivory carvings are all beautifully preserved and displayed. I particularly enjoyed the section on traditional Kathakali costumes and the impressive collection of temple chariots.

The grounds surrounding the museum are equally lovely, providing a peaceful escape from the city's hustle and bustle. The lush green lawns, blooming flowers, and the nearby Trivandrum Zoo make for a perfect day out.

The staff were friendly and helpful, and the museum was clean and well-maintained. The Napier Museum is a true gem in Trivandrum, offering a wonderful blend of history, art, and nature. It's a must-visit for anyone interested in the cultural heritage of Kerala.

Nestled in the heart of Trivandrum, the Napier Museum is a graceful blend of heritage architecture and cultural riches. Built in 1880, this red‚Äëbrick Indo‚ÄëSaracenic marvel fuses Gothic gables, Kerala sloping roofs, Chinese minarets, and Italianate detailing - a feast for architecture lovers.

Stepping inside, you‚Äôll discover a treasure trove: over 550 artifacts ranging from temple chariots, bronze idols, Kathakali masks, and ivory carvings to a fascinating Japanese leather shadow‚Äëplay collection depicting the Mahabharata and Ramayana.

History buffs will appreciate the coin gallery boasting more than 5,000 coins from South India, Persia, Rome, and beyond. Highlights include an 8th‚Äëcentury Vishnu idol, the Sword of Velu Thampi Dalawa, and rare bronze and wooden sculptures.

One of the most charming features is the museum‚Äôs natural air‚Äëconditioning double‚Äëwalled ventilation and stained glass windows keep it cool even on warm days.

The museum forms part of a fascinating complex alongside the Thiruvananthapuram Zoo (Established in 1857), the Natural History Museum, Aquarium and the Sree Chitra Art Gallery,  enriching your visit with diverse experiences

Tips for your visit:
Visit early on a weekday to avoid crowds, allocate a minimum of 2 hours for the full experience.
Open from 10‚ÄØam - 4:45‚ÄØpm; closed on Mondays and some public holidays.
Tickets are budget‚Äëfriendly: approx ‚Çπ20 for adults (Indian) and ‚Çπ10 for kids.

Presently, it is under the Kerala State Government. It's elegantly designed .

An Amazing Place to Relax, Explore, and Enjoy ‚Äì A Must-Visit Spot in Thiruvananthapuram!

Kanakakkunnu Palace is one of the most beautiful and peaceful places in the city of Thiruvananthapuram. Nestled among greenery and built with stunning architecture, this historic palace is more than just a monument ‚Äì it's an experience. I‚Äôve visited this place many times, and every visit feels refreshing and unique.

The first thing that strikes you is the serene and natural surroundings. The palace is surrounded by sprawling lawns, tall trees, and beautifully landscaped gardens. It‚Äôs a perfect spot to unwind and disconnect from the daily hustle of city life. Whether you're coming here with family, friends, or even alone, there‚Äôs always a peaceful vibe that makes you feel calm and recharged.

One of the biggest highlights of Kanakakkunnu is the ambiance during the evenings and night. As the sun sets, the palace and the entire grounds are lit up beautifully, giving it a royal and almost magical charm. The soft lighting, the quiet surroundings, and the cool breeze create a soothing atmosphere that's ideal for night walks, casual conversations, or simply enjoying the beauty around you. The night vibe here is highly recommended, especially if you enjoy peaceful, scenic places with character.

Apart from just relaxing, Kanakakkunnu also serves as a cultural hub. Many art exhibitions, cultural events, and traditional programs are held here throughout the year. During festivals or special occasions, the palace comes alive with music, lights, and activities ‚Äì it‚Äôs a great way to experience Kerala's rich culture and traditions.

There are plenty of open areas where you can sit and enjoy the view, read a book, or even have a casual picnic. The whole campus is clean and well-maintained, which shows the effort taken by the authorities to preserve its beauty. It‚Äôs also a popular spot for photography lovers ‚Äì the combination of old architecture and natural scenery offers the perfect backdrop.

Another thing I really appreciate is how accessible and welcoming the place is. There is good parking space nearby, and small stalls outside sell tea, coffee, and snacks, making it convenient for visitors. Entry is usually free or minimal, and it's safe even during the night, which is a big plus.

Overall, I would say Kanakakkunnu Palace is not just a tourist attraction ‚Äì it‚Äôs a peaceful retreat, a cultural hotspot, and a heritage landmark all in one. It‚Äôs a must-visit place for anyone in or around Thiruvananthapuram, whether you are a local resident or a tourist. If you have a few free hours in the evening or want to explore something beautiful and relaxing, this is the place to go.

Kanakakunnu Palace grounds are truly refreshing for a morning walk. The entire area is beautifully maintained with clean walking paths, lush greenery, and fresh air. You can see many walkers, joggers, and families enjoying the serene atmosphere early in the morning.

One of the best places in Trivandrum city to connect with nature, refresh your mind, and begin your day positively. Highly recommended for morning walkers, yoga practitioners, or anyone who loves a calm outdoor space within the city.

Vizhinjam Rock-Cut Cave, located near the coastal town of Vizhinjam in Thiruvananthapuram district( Near to vizhinjam police station ) This small yet significant cave is renowned for its ancient rock-cut sculptures and inscriptions, making it a must-visit destination for history enthusiasts, archaeologists, and tourists.The Vizhinjam Rock-Cut Cave dates back to the 8th century AD and is believed to have been built during the reign of the Ay dynasty, a prominent ruling dynasty in southern Kerala. The cave temple reflects the early phase of Dravidian architecture and serves as an important relic of the region's ancient history. The sculptures and inscriptions found within the cave provide valuable insights into the religious practices, artistic styles, and cultural influences of that era.

The ancient carvings depicting various deities and mythological scenes showcase the craftsmanship of a bygone era, adding an element of cultural richness to the temple. The well-preserved nature of the rock-cut architecture speaks to the enduring legacy of this sacred site.

Despite its historical value, the temple's accessibility may pose a challenge for some visitors due to its remote location. However, for those willing to make the journey, the Rock Cut Cave Shiva Temple offers a unique and rewarding experience, blending spirituality with architectural excellence in a setting that resonates with tranquility and historical significance.

placeMetadata.name: Koyikkal Palace

sources.snippet: Koyikkal Palace located in Nedumangad, Thiruvananthapuram is a living symbol of the extravagance of traditional architecture which prevailed in Kerala during the Seventeenth century. It is a double-story palace built in the conventional Nalukettu architectural style of Kerala for Umayamma Rani, the regent of the Venad Royal family between 1677 and 1684. It currently hosts a Folklore and Numismatics Museum with a rich antique collection.
sources.shortName: Historical landmarks in Trivandrum

sources.snippet: Koyikkal Palace is a 16th century palace located 15 kilometers from Trivandrum. The Palace is known for its classic layout, design true to the Travancore style and is a hotspot for Archaeology buffs as its accommodates a Folklore museum and a Numismatics museum. The museums contain some of the rarest collections around the world.
sources.shortName: Famous Historical Places in Trivandrum

placeMetadata.description: Traditional 2-story Kerala palace, built in 1677, with folklore & numismatics museums & tours.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Koyikkal Palace, a traditional 2-story Kerala palace dating back to 1677, is home to folklore and numismatics museums. The Keralam Museum has implemented modern techniques in refurbishing archaeological museums at various locations and played a pivotal role in establishing district heritage museums across the region. This historical site is one of the major tourist attractions in Thiruvananthapuram, offering visitors a glimpse into Kerala's rich cultural heritage.

reviews.reviewText: Koyikkal Palace is a calm and beautiful place in Kerala. The palace is built in the traditional Kerala style with wooden walls and sloping roofs. Inside, there is a small museum that shows interesting items about the history and royal life of Kerala. The palace is surrounded by trees and nature, making it a peaceful place to visit. It‚Äôs a great spot for anyone interested in history or looking for a quiet place to relax.

Koyikkal Palace in Nedumangad is  a peaceful place with serious old-world vibes. It‚Äôs not one of those massive royal palaces, but what it lacks in size, it makes up for in charm and history.

The building itself is this beautiful old Kerala-style structure with sloping tiled roofs and wooden beams‚Äîsuper traditional and photogenic. You can literally feel the history in the air. It was built way back in the 1600s.

Inside, there are museums. The Folklore Museum has some really cool stuff like old musical instruments, traditional lamps, costumes, and even tools people used ages ago. On the ground floor is the coin museum, Ancient coins collections are there. The place isn‚Äôt crowded at all‚Äîperfect if you want a quiet, thoughtful afternoon. The gardens around the palace are also nice, and it‚Äôs a great spot if you‚Äôre into photography, culture, or just want a chill outing away from the usual city spots.

Koyikkal Palace in Nedumangadu is a beautiful historic spot that perfectly blends culture and architecture. The palace is well-maintained, and the museum inside is very informative, showcasing traditional Kerala artifacts, coins, and antiques. The calm and peaceful surroundings make it a great place to spend some quiet time while exploring history. A must-visit for anyone interested in Kerala‚Äôs heritage.

Koyikkal Palace, Trivandrum

Koyikkal Palace, located in Nedumangadu, near Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, is a historical palace built in the 17th century for Umayamma Rani of the Venad royal family. This traditional Nalukettu-style palace is known for its unique architecture and serves as a historical and cultural museum under the Kerala State Archaeology Department.

The palace houses two museums:

1. Folklore Museum ‚Äì Showcasing traditional musical instruments, household utensils, and rare manuscripts that provide insights into Kerala‚Äôs cultural heritage.

2. Numismatics Museum ‚Äì Displaying an extensive collection of ancient coins, including the rare Ottaputhan, Kaliyugarayan Panam, and coins from the Roman and Mughal periods.

Surrounded by lush greenery, Koyikkal Palace is a must-visit for history enthusiasts and those interested in Kerala‚Äôs royal past.
Calm and piece full atmosphere to spend at cheap cost. A well maintained palace and its pride to us. We can spend much more time we want. For me it was wonderful experience

To be honest, I might‚Äôve been a bit influenced by the stories and rumors, but I didn‚Äôt really find anything extraordinary about this palace. It mostly feels like a regular exhibition. If you‚Äôve been to the Keralam History and Heritage Museum, the vibe is pretty similar ‚Äî except the Keralam Museum has more stunning sculptures, cave paintings, and artistic displays. That said, Koyikkal Palace does have a few things that make it unique. I won‚Äôt spoil anything, but there are some interesting elements that are worth checking out. I still encourage everyone to visit it at least once. I went today, and I was the only visitor there üòÖ ‚Äî which actually made the experience even better.You can ask the staff more about the palace‚Äôs history or even the rumored stories connected to it ‚Äî they‚Äôre usually happy to share. Entry is super affordable: just ‚Çπ30 for adults, ‚Çπ10 if you want to use your phone camera, and ‚Çπ150 extra if you‚Äôre planning to take videos or reels.

So yeah, not mind-blowing, but peaceful, low-key interesting, and worth a visit if you're into heritage spots.

Small palace which was a headquarters of Perakom. The palace is built in the Nalukettu architecture.
A small is needed for entering. Inside there is artifacts used by tribals, medieval Kerala, etc.

A well-preserved traditional palace that offers a quiet look into Kerala‚Äôs royal and cultural history. The museum inside has interesting artifacts, including old coins and musical instruments. The architecture and surroundings give a peaceful, heritage feel. A nice stop for history lovers.

reviews.reviewText: They design buildings with context to the site and environment. They use the advanced BIM software for every consturction purpose drawings.

When we wanted to build our dream home, we knew that the role of the architect is going to be super important. After meeting a few architects, we chose S Squared architects and it was one of the best decisions we made. The combination of professionalism, their skills not only in the domain of architecture but also in the interactions and understanding our needs is commendable.
The design of the patio, the connectivity among some of the rooms in the ground floor, cross ventilation, bringing natural light as an element in the design, unique blend of architecture and comfort for living- these were the highlights.
The end result did exceed our expectations and I would highly recommend S Squared architecture to build your dream home.
The best Architect firm located in Trivandrum having offices in Cochin and Delhi‚Ä¶ Great designs and timely completion of projects  @ affordable rates‚Ä¶.

Recently got to know that one of the lavish home in Kerala is designed by S Square Architects Pvt Ltd.

Every corner of this palatial villa designed by S Squared Architects sparkles with natural elements‚Äîfrom flora and fauna to stonework and water features‚Äî making it an instantly inviting and breathtaking home.

The bungalow built on a six acre property in Trivandrum consists of a semi basement, three floors and a high roof attic. The semi basement houses all the service needs of the house including the electrical rooms, parking spaces, pool tank etc. The bedrooms, living spaces and den are housed on the first and second floor. The most vibrant space of the house is the attic converted into a recreational area dotted with chess and cards table, gaming stations and billiards board. There is also a small pantry for game nights. The piece de resistance is the ceiling which is hand-painted to resemble a vintage map. The flooring makes use of the leftover wood from the construction. A look out balcony on this floor comes with awe-inspiring views of the Indian ocean.

A central courtyard separates the more private spaces from the formal drawing room meant for guests. The five en-suite bedrooms are accessible through foyers from the central courtyard. There is a grand library on the second floor with a home office placed within.

The crowning glory of the house is the indoor swimming pool. ‚ÄúThis is the activity hub of the house with framed views from the dining room, living room, kitchen and the master bedroom. The gym also opens out into this space. There is an interesting bar at the corner. The pool is naturally lit with a skylight that allows the morning light to filter in bestowing upon it a magical sun kissed aura that defines the start of the day. It is an oasis of peace and relaxation for the inhabitants and creates a dramatic escape from the busy life.

Prioritising high-quality materials over ornamentation, the designers wove a sense of bespoke craftsmanship into each room. ‚ÄúWe had to acclimatise the design to respond to challenges of the local climate and locally available materials and construction techniques. A skin wall was added to the exterior walls to protect it from the harsh Kerala sun and rain.

A heavy cornice work at the edge of the sloping roof not just conceals the rainwater gutter but also minimises impact of rainwater on the walls. The sandstone slabs left over from the indoor swimming pool flooring was used for the cracked effect flooring of the gazebo reducing wastage of material. The semi basement of the house has been camouflaged using a gently sloping mound of lush green lawn and graceful curved masses of mixed planting which creates a stunning contrast to the honey coloured walls. It‚Äôs a quirky house: asymmetrical and interesting, with surprises around every corner.

His attention to detail, innovative approach, and understanding of modern living spaces truly stand out. Each project seems to balance aesthetics with functionality effortlessly, creating spaces that are both beautiful and practical. The seamless integration of natural elements, the smart use of space, and the thoughtful design choices really make a difference. Highly recommend his services for anyone looking for a truly personalised and visionary architectural experience.

We're absolutely delighted with the home Srijit designed for us! The thoughtful integration of ample space, natural light, and modern facilities has exceeded our expectations. Srijit's professionalism, creativity, and commitment to delivering our dream home are commendable. We highly recommend him.

Srijit Srinivas designed our house 11 years ago. From the initial designing phase itself, we could see how determined he was to ensure the aesthetic quality of our house. Another thing about him that impressed us was that he had a clear idea about the minute details in his plan and the plan covered all the facilities we needed. He vowed with his futuristic ideas which we were sure would become trendsetters. Our expectations were not wrong as visitors compliment the classy designs even today.
I would like to thank Srijit Srinivas Architects for building our dream home.

My 4 bedroom house is an example of how perfect architectural planning by Srijit has brought so much comfort and value to my house. The openness inside the house is amazing, the courtyard brings in that freshness and is lively.  The house is minimalist,  there is every protection from heavy rains, sun etc ( all subtly designed) and we are so happy to experience the wonderful spaces with no troubles at all.
Srijit Srinivas Architects are thorough professionals- they will charge you a reasonable fee, but take my word, you will get all your money's worth, once u see the output.
Thanking you once again for the lovely design‚Äù üëçüèæ

Srijit Srinivas Architects is a professional architecture firm. Mr. Srijit Srinivas is the Architect who designed my family's house. The first and only design proposed by Srijit Srinivas met our expectations and reflected the details of our detailed discussions. His commitment and passion for his own designs and towards our Project was palpable in the detailing on safety, simplicity and aesthetics that he gave to our house. We are profoundly delighted by the final work product and the serene and calm environment he created for his architectural baby, which we now call our home. While his rationale for retaining a professional identity as an Architect for his firm is well justified and therefore, dependence on and choice of external civil construction agencies, Srijit might wish to consider a growing expectation from his prospective clients to identify a committed self sustaining civil engineering team as part and parcel of his own firm - who will have the ability to read his marvellous designs and convert them into elegant rational forms.

Very happy to have been associated with Srijit for our own Project. It is a relationship that we as a family have built beyond Srijit's professional prowess. I would thoroughly recommend Srijit Srinivas as a thinking professional architect, if you are ever in search of one.

The feeling we get because of the rumbling of the water in the pond in the back of my ears and the full greenery seen through the large open main doors when sitting in one of the chairs in the dining hall is the most satisfying and relaxing thing we get and when this happens in a cloudy and rainy day it‚Äôs like an extra icing on the top as seeing rain is one of my hobbies.
Yes really it‚Äôs so so so pleasing and relaxing

When my parents decided to build a third house, unlike the previous times they left it upon us to come up with ideas and find an architect. After an elaborate search on the net, i came across Srijit sirs work and i had this instant gut feeling to go for him.
Once we had an official discussion where we sat down for describing our needs and purposes, which he wholeheartedly accepted , we were all immensely happy.
All he said was ‚ÄúNow leave everything to me‚Äù and from there on he took the full responsibility of getting our dream house completed on time even when the Covid situation was prevailing.
I would say i have rarely come across a person with such clarity of thoughts and extra ordinary visualisation! Both of these virtues makes an architect  stand out from the rest.
though its been 2 years since we moved to our new home , its still as special as it was on day one. All credits go to the Architect himself. üôåüèª

Have worked with Srijit in building my new house.  It's not often that we see an architect who keeps the barrier so high for himself in everything he does in the project.  Srijit always comes out with minimal and neat, yet in-vogue /head-turning designs. Aesthetics is his forte and he does micro detailing  to levels which baffles one.

On hindsight, one of the best things I have ever done is to have resisted the urge to  provide "client's gyaan" to Srijit on his design choices!  Each time we (my wife and myself) felt the urge to 'improvise' on Srijit's design/aesthetics related related choices - we did not press for it.
"Let us leave it to Srijit, he should be right" - was our refrain.  Once the house was completed, we realised how right and wise - we were!

In short - Leave it to Srijit. He will help you build a beautiful home :)
