reviews.reviewText:
I recently had the pleasure of organising the Onam celebration at the Sai Trivandrum Golf Club, for the community of Brio League Centre for Holistic Nutrition. It was a perfect blend of tradition and wellness, with the scenic backdrop of the lush golf course adding a serene touch to the festivities.

The highlight of the event was undoubtedly the Sadya catered by White Damor. It was a grand feast that perfectly captured the essence of Onam. Every dish was authentic, flavorful, and prepared with fresh ingredients. The variety on the banana leaf‚Äîfrom the delicious sambar, rasam, and avial to the sweet ending with payasam‚Äîwas a true treat for the senses. What stood out was the balance of traditional flavors with a healthy twist, which resonated with the Brio League‚Äôs ethos of holistic nutrition.

The attention to detail by White Damor was impeccable. Not only did they ensure the Sadya followed traditional customs, but the portion sizes and the quality of the food also reflected a focus on health and wellness. It was comforting to know that one could indulge in a festive meal without compromising on nutrition.

Sai Trivandrum Golf Club offered the perfect venue for the celebration. Its sprawling greens, peaceful ambiance, and well-maintained facilities made the event even more enjoyable. The team at Brio League did an excellent job in organizing the event, seamlessly blending cultural celebration with their mission of promoting holistic health.

Overall, the event was a wonderful experience, and the Sadya by White Damor was an unforgettable highlight. I look forward to more such celebrations where tradition meets wellness in a beautiful setting like Sai Trivandrum Golf Club.

Nestled amidst lush greenery, the golf club exudes a serene charm, surrounded by towering trees that sway gently in the breeze.
The meticulously manicured fairways stretch gracefully, blending harmoniously with the natural landscape
. A variety of birds, from vibrant songbirds to majestic eagles, add life to the tranquil setting, their melodies weaving into the silence of the rolling greens. The exclusivity of the club enhances its allure, with restricted entry ensuring an atmosphere of peace and privacy. Here, amidst nature‚Äôs embrace, every swing feels like a moment of pure escape, a retreat into a world where elegance meets the untouched beauty of the wild.
Good ambiance... Only members allowed... Archery training by Trivandrum Archery Academy is there....

The staff were exquisite and polite. The atmosphere exudes luxury, offering a quiet and calm experience. If you're anywhere near this place, it's a no-brainer‚Äîespecially if you enjoy connecting with like-minded individuals.

First time i am visiting this golf ground. It was very nice location but management was not that much closer to others common peoples. They are very strict and little rudeness in character. Canteen food quality also good. Very cool atmosphere. They maintain the surrounding neet and clean. Restroom also hygienic.

I had a wonderful experience here. The calm and peaceful atmosphere made it the perfect place to unwind. The well-maintained greens and friendly staff added to the charm. It‚Äôs a great spot to enjoy a relaxing game amidst nature. Definitely worth visiting!

It's a quiet preserve in the heart of the city. Trees abound and there are nooks and crannies where you can sit and watch people take up their golf clubs for the first time and practice driving into the nets.

The atmosphere is tranquil and the greens stretch far into the distance. We're here on a weekend and the number of cars probably exceeds the number of players

The rooms are big with high ceilings laid out with wooden planks. The balconies are a good place to take in the view.

Not much choice in terms of food but a hot cuppa tea in the morning makes more sense than most other things in life.

We wandered around the environs and came across a swing with a thin log, not a plank. In most places, when an adult takes to the swing, it looks incongruous. But we were saved by the lack of an audience, even though I took a tumble by trying to step off too soon!

This is one of the oldest Golf Clubs in the continent. One will be really amazed to find something like this in the midst of the city. You can see shades of chinese architecture in the buildings and arena in the club too. However, they are poorly maintained. It isn't open for public but one can book it for function/parties and so on.  The atmosphere is calm and pleasant. There is a cafe, and there are also suit rooms available.. Pet's are not allowed and ironically, one can spot stray dogs here and there.

reviews.reviewText: Kerala Greenery is undoubtedly the best tour operator in Kerala! We booked one of their luxury family tour packages, and every detail was flawlessly executed. Our trip was seamless, stress-free, and truly memorable. Friends have also raved about their Kerala honeymoon tours, making them the perfect choice for couples seeking a romantic getaway. Whether you‚Äôre planning a dreamy honeymoon or an unforgettable family vacation, Kerala Greenery is the go-to expert. Thank you for making our Kerala experience so special!

I had an incredible experience with Kerala Greenery. They offer the best tour packages for couples in Kerala, perfect for a romantic getaway. Their Kerala honeymoon tours are well-organized and cater to every little detail. We loved the mix of luxury and natural beauty in the deluxe tour packages in Kerala. Highly recommend them as the best tour operator in Kerala!

Our corporate retreat organized by Kerala Greenery was a resounding success. They managed to seamlessly blend team-building activities with leisure, providing a well-rounded experience for our team.Kerala Greenery's expertise in handling group tours was evident, and we look forward to partnering with them for future events.

Our cultural tour of Kerala with Kerala Greenery was enlightening. We explored historic sites, attended traditional dance performances, and visited local markets. The guides provided in-depth information about Kerala's history, art, and traditions, making the experience immersive. The accommodations reflected the local architecture, adding to the authenticity of the trip. Kerala Greenery's attention to detail and passion for their culture were evident throughout the tour. We returned home with a deeper appreciation for Kerala's rich heritage.

Excellent experience.  Professional and well organized.

The tour was well organized, from the time that we landed at Kochi airport, to the time that we were dropped off on our last day.

As per the schedule, all items in our itinerary were covered, all accomodations were of acceptable, if not superior standards and the locations covered were exceptional.  The houseboat ride was probably the highlight of the tour.

A very special thanks go to our driver and friend, Mr. Unni, who was a very patient and friendly individual.  He took every precuation possible to ensure that our journey was safe, and made an extra effort each time to drive carefully in order to ensure the safety of the passengers.

As for suggestions, our only request is that we be prepared with the details of each activity in advance.  As an example, it would have helped us if we were informed beforehand that the boat ride on the Thekkady wildlife sanctuary would involve wearing life-jackets and that the seats would be pre-allocated at the time of purchasing the tickets.  Our expectations of the boat ride was also very high, and were disappointed that we were unable to see the kind of wildlife that we were expecting.  This caused a minor inconvenience during our trip, and could have been avoided if we were informed beforehand.

Overall though, it was a very memorable trip that we will cherish for a very long time.
If you're looking for the best tour operator in Kerala, KeralaGreenery is the one! They curated the perfect Kerala tour package for us. Unforgettable experience!

It was a super trip. Kalathil Resort was a nice stay.
Our Cab driver Mr. Unni was so friendly and guided through all tourist spots.
House boat stay was also nice.
Food in both resort and house boat were excellent.
My point-of-contact Subhash was reachable at anytime through Whats app and cleared all my travel related inquires instantly.

The only glitch was that, the Aqua Serene houseboat was bad compared to other house boats which I saw there. There is no entertainment. Made me felt like should have choosed some other House boats.

Overall it was a great trip and we didn't felt like roaming in our own city :)

SIR, We have got in touch through Mr. subash, from the day one he was very helpful and flexible. what our i doubt i got he explain and also given all concessions available and made our trip a tailor made. one. the cab drivers are very caring and helpful. we won' t forget the driver who have taken us even in day like Onem. the boat people are very friendly and facilities in boat is also good. One thing we want to knew that r u arranging trip like this in karnataka and AP?. thank u sir

ops.insert: Architecturally unique 19th-century building with archeological & historical artifacts, plus art.
Short thoroughfare encircling the namesake colonial-era building situated on landscaped grounds.
Picturesque freshwater lake offering abundant flora & fauna, boat rides & walking trails.

Thiruvananthapuram (or Trivandrum) is the capital of the southern Indian state of Kerala. It's distinguished by its British colonial architecture and many art galleries. It‚Äôs also home to Kuthira Malika (or Puthen Malika) Palace, adorned with carved horses and displaying collections related to the Travancore royal family, whose regional capital was here from the 18th‚Äì20th centuries.
Named for the 122 carved horses in its walls, this 1840s palace features a museum & guided tours.

Vizhinjam is an area located in the city of Thiruvananthapuram, the capital city of the state of Kerala in India. which belongs to Thiruvananthapuram Corporation. It is located 16 km south west from the city centre and 17 km south of Trivandrum International Airport along NH66. Wikipedia.
Palace museum with art & artifacts from the royal family, plus an annual courtyard music festival.
Traditional 2-story Kerala palace, built in 1677, with folklore & numismatics museums & tours.

placeMetadata.name: Napier Museum

sources.snippet: Having made a place in the heart of this capital city, Napier museum is the center of attraction for all the art lovers. The finess and uniqueness of the contents of the museum is sure to make you go awe. The Indo-Saracenic style architectural of the building is itself worth seeing and appreciating and thus makes it one of the most famous and largely visited museums of the country.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Trivandrum Tourist Places to Visit During Kerala Trip

sources.snippet: Named after a former British Governor (Lord Francis Napier) the Napier Museum is something you can‚Äôt afford to miss while in the city. With rare collections of bronze articles, antique musical instruments and ivory carvings, it is also known for its admirable architectural design. The museum also has Zoological Gardens and is known to be one of the well-planned zoos of Asia.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places To Visit In Trivandrum (Thiruvananthapuram)

sources.snippet: The Napier Museum stands out visually due to the Indo-Saracenic style it was built in this itself should be a good enough reason for photographers to visit it!. In addition to this museum containing lots of artifacts like ancient bronze idols, ivory carving, traditional Kerala lamps among others. Near the museum is Thiruvananthapuram Zoo, one of the oldest zoos in India.
sources.shortName: Capture Stunning Shots With These Best Photography Places In Thiruvananthapuram

sources.snippet: Situated in the heart of Trivandrum, Napier Museum is the perfect place to get a glimpse of the rich cultural history of Kerala. It was built in the 19 th-Century and houses historical artifacts including ancient ornaments, bronze sculptures, ivory carvings, and paintings. This museum is an architectural marvel and a perfect blend of Indo-Saracenic style.
sources.shortName: 15 Amazing Places to Visit in Trivandrum

sources.snippet: Napier Museum is located inside Trivandrum Zoo which is the oldest zoological garden in India established in 1857 on over 55 acres of land. It also contains Sree Chitra Art Gallery established in 1935 and is one of the best tourist places in Trivandrum. The entire complex is managed by the Department of Museum and Zoos of Kerala.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places In Trivandrum - Top 10 Must-visit Destinations

sources.snippet: Situated in the vibrant city of Thiruvananthapuram, the Napier Museum stands as a testament to art, culture, and natural history. Established in 1880 under the patronage of Francis Napier, the 10th Lord Napier, the museum is renowned for its Indo-Saracenic architecture, influenced by Indian, Chinese, Kerala, and Mughal styles.
sources.shortName: 43 Best Places to visit in Trivandrum | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Spending an afternoon in the Napier Museum is one of the best things that a tourist can do in Trivandrum. The legacy of the museum makes it one of the prime tourist spots of the city. Founded in 1855 and reconstructed in 1874, Napier Museum became an established site for historical and archaeological collections.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Tourist Spots In Thiruvananthapuram (Trivandrum), India

sources.snippet: At a distance of about 3.5 km from Trivandrum Central Railway Station, the Napier Museum is an art and natural history museum situated in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala. Also known as Government Art Museum, it is one of the popular museums in Kerala, and among the most prominent places of sightseeing in Trivandrum.
sources.shortName: 35 Best Places to Visit in Trivandrum, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: This amazing building is situated very near to the Napier Museum. It‚Äôs an embodiment of excellent craftsmanship and architecture. You should definitely stop by for a quick visit, you won‚Äôt regret.

placeMetadata.description: Architecturally unique 19th-century building with archeological & historical artifacts, plus art.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Napier Museum, located in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, is a 19th-century architectural marvel housing archaeological artifacts, historical relics, and art pieces. The museum features royal seats with Chinese engravings, a musical bow in mahogany, colored windows, and intricately painted and carved rosewood ceilings. Situated near the museum is the Kanakakunnu Palace which was once used as a summer retreat by the Travancore royal family to entertain guests.
placeMetadata.address: LMS Vellayambalam Rd, near Museum Junction, Kanaka Nagar, Nanthancodu, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695033, India

reviews.reviewText:
Napier Museum is truly a gem in the heart of Thiruvananthapuram. It‚Äôs a great place to take a relaxed walk, unwind, and enjoy some peaceful moments amidst nature‚Äîeven while being right in the middle of the city. The area is quite spacious, making it ideal for peaceful seating, thoughtful discussions, or simply soaking in the serene atmosphere.

From big to small, famous to local, museums give us places to think, grow, learn, wonder, and feel. Few cultural institutions have remained as important as museums over the decades. They preserve and promote social interests as diverse and unique as the people who visit them‚Äîand Napier Museum is no exception.

A night walk here is something truly special‚Äîthe calm surroundings, the cool breeze, and the beautifully lit pathways create a soothing ambiance that‚Äôs perfect for reflection or quiet conversations.

Whether you‚Äôre looking to reconnect with history, enjoy quiet time outdoors, or just take a refreshing stroll, Napier Museum offers something special for everyone. A must-visit for both locals and travelers alike.

One of the popular museums situated in the heart of the city and within the complex next to the famous Trivandrum zoo. One needs to buy a ticket to enter the museum and there is a paid parking facility available nearby.
The architecture of the museum and the park around captivate anyone very easily to visit it from afar. There are sculptures, displays and paintings inside but a limited experience. The place needs more maintenance and the continuous audio ads disturb the peaceful environment of the park.

Napier Museum: Where History, Nature & Calm Come Together üèõÔ∏èüåøüïäÔ∏è

It‚Äôs an experience that deserves an entire day to truly absorb. Spread across a huge, well maintained space, the place is spotlessly clean and beautifully organized, offering a calm escape right in the city.

The museum itself is free to enter, while the adjoining zoo entry costs just ‚Çπ50, which also includes a locker facility for bags and even plastic bottles a thoughtful touch for keeping the space clean. The zoo is expansive, and right outside, a small caf√© serves as the perfect refresher after a walk.

What makes this venue special is the balance it offers: while the exhibits and zoo engage your curiosity, the grounds themselves invite you to slow down. There are plenty of shaded spots and tree-side seating areas, making it easy to pause, rest, or just take in the serene atmosphere. Despite the outside heat, the entire space feels naturally cooler, adding to the comfort.

Whether you‚Äôre interested in history, looking to enjoy a day amidst nature, or simply searching for a peaceful retreat, Napier Museum is one of those rare places where you can do it all at once.

Atmosphere is nice, nicely maintained garden. Inside is a bit old, some of the beam concrete have already fell down from the ceiling. You can look into the past there are some ancient artifacts. Also there's a dedicated staff to guide us through them. You can take photos but need permission to take videos!!! Idk weird, anyways spend some good time there, won't be disappointing.

The Napier Museum in Trivandrum is a beautiful blend of history and architecture. The Indo-Saracenic design, colorful stained-glass windows, and peaceful garden surroundings create a serene atmosphere. The museum houses fascinating artifacts like bronze idols, ivory carvings, and historical weapons. A short but enriching visit for anyone interested in Kerala‚Äôs cultural heritage.

Napier Museum is a meticulously organized and captivating venue that highlights India's extensive cultural legacy. The museum features ancient statues dating back over 2000 years, alongside an impressive array of coins, sculptures, and weaponry. With a wealth of exhibits to explore, it offers a truly enriching experience. One cannot help but feel immense pride in witnessing the advanced knowledge and creativity of our forebears. The museum is beautifully preserved, complemented by a well-kept landscape surrounding the main structure. Centrally located, it is highly recommended for tourists and students alike to delve into and appreciate history!

"I recently had the pleasure of visiting the Napier Museum in Trivandrum and was thoroughly impressed. The museum is a beautiful example of Indo-Saracenic architecture, and its stunning red and white exterior is a sight to behold.

Inside, the collection is a fascinating journey through Kerala's rich history and culture. The bronze sculptures, ancient musical instruments, and intricate ivory carvings are all beautifully preserved and displayed. I particularly enjoyed the section on traditional Kathakali costumes and the impressive collection of temple chariots.

The grounds surrounding the museum are equally lovely, providing a peaceful escape from the city's hustle and bustle. The lush green lawns, blooming flowers, and the nearby Trivandrum Zoo make for a perfect day out.

The staff were friendly and helpful, and the museum was clean and well-maintained. The Napier Museum is a true gem in Trivandrum, offering a wonderful blend of history, art, and nature. It's a must-visit for anyone interested in the cultural heritage of Kerala.

Nestled in the heart of Trivandrum, the Napier Museum is a graceful blend of heritage architecture and cultural riches. Built in 1880, this red‚Äëbrick Indo‚ÄëSaracenic marvel fuses Gothic gables, Kerala sloping roofs, Chinese minarets, and Italianate detailing - a feast for architecture lovers.

Stepping inside, you‚Äôll discover a treasure trove: over 550 artifacts ranging from temple chariots, bronze idols, Kathakali masks, and ivory carvings to a fascinating Japanese leather shadow‚Äëplay collection depicting the Mahabharata and Ramayana.

History buffs will appreciate the coin gallery boasting more than 5,000 coins from South India, Persia, Rome, and beyond. Highlights include an 8th‚Äëcentury Vishnu idol, the Sword of Velu Thampi Dalawa, and rare bronze and wooden sculptures.

One of the most charming features is the museum‚Äôs natural air‚Äëconditioning double‚Äëwalled ventilation and stained glass windows keep it cool even on warm days.

The museum forms part of a fascinating complex alongside the Thiruvananthapuram Zoo (Established in 1857), the Natural History Museum, Aquarium and the Sree Chitra Art Gallery,  enriching your visit with diverse experiences

Tips for your visit:
Visit early on a weekday to avoid crowds, allocate a minimum of 2 hours for the full experience.
Open from 10‚ÄØam - 4:45‚ÄØpm; closed on Mondays and some public holidays.
Tickets are budget‚Äëfriendly: approx ‚Çπ20 for adults (Indian) and ‚Çπ10 for kids.

placeMetadata.name: Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple

sources.snippet: Sri Padmanabhaswamy Temple is one of the ancient temples of Kerala and it stands tall with all its pride and glory in the capital city, i.e Trivandrum. This gold capped temple is one of the oldest temples in India out of the 108 temples of the Hindu deity Vishnu. In Hinduism, it is one of the most sacred temples of Lord Vishnu where one will be able to witness the Lord in his ‚ÄúAnantha Shayanam" posture through the three massive doors.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Tourist Spots In Thiruvananthapuram (Trivandrum), India

sources.snippet: One of the most notable landmarks in Thiruvananthapuram is Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple. This old temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu has got amazing Dravidian-style architectural design and intricate carvings. The temple's massive gateway tower (gopuram) and sacred pond are remarkable subjects for architectural and cultural photography.
sources.shortName: Capture Stunning Shots With These Best Photography Places In Thiruvananthapuram

sources.snippet: One of the 108 temples dedicated to Lord Vishnu, this ancient temple is an iconic religious site and one of the most popular places to visit in Trivandrum. Within the temple's premises, tourists can find intricate carvings along with a massive deity idol of Lord Vishnu reclining on the hooded serpent Anantha.
sources.shortName: Thiruvananthapuram (Trivendrum) -  Tourist Places in 2024

sources.snippet: Padmanabhaswamy Temple, which is situated inside the East Fort in the heart of Trivandrum is dedicated to Lord Vishnu. The temple is famous for having the deity in the eternal sleep posture. It is also considered to be sacred by the Hindus who come to worship the deity all year long.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places To Visit In Trivandrum (Thiruvananthapuram)

sources.snippet: Among the richest of all temples, the Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple is dedicated to a reincarnation of Lord Vishnu ‚Äì Lord Padmanabha. This temple in Trivandrum is also famous for its firm rules of worship. There are definite dress codes to be followed by its visitors.
sources.siteName: SreesTours Official Blog About Kerala Tourism
sources.shortName: 18 Finest Tourist Places to Visit in Trivandrum with Family for a Memorable Trip

sources.snippet: The must visit place in your itinerary should be this place. The temple is a popular Lord Padmanabha temple- a reincarnation of Lord Vishnu. To the disappointment of many, the temple sees only the hindu devotees inside it.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Trivandrum Tourist Places to Visit During Kerala Trip

sources.snippet: In fact, the name comes from the temple,‚ÄòThiru‚Äô ‚ÄòAnantha‚Äô ‚ÄòPuram‚Äô, which means Sacred Abode of Lord Anantha Padmanabha. You can enjoy the evening aarti and offer prayer to God with locals.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Places to Visit in Trivandrum at Night

sources.snippet: After forming the Travancore kingdom, Maharaja Marthanada Varma dedicated it to Lord Padmanabha, the presiding deity of Shri Padmanabhaswamy temple and named the city ‚ÄòThiruvananthapuram‚Äô.
sources.shortName: Thiruvananthapuram Tourism | Thiruvananthapuram Tourist Places | Thiruvananthapuram Travel Guide | Thiruvananthapuram Weather | Thiruvananthapuram Photos

reviews.reviewText:
Visiting sacred Sree Padmanabhaswamy temple is a  complete bliss!!!
One of the oldest and richest shrines of Lord Vishnu, one can witness the lord in anantashyana posture through three doors of this temple. The architecture, divine energy and rich Kerala tradition well witnessed in this sacred place.

Tips for a pleasant visit:
1. Strict dress code to be followed by devotees ( traditional dress for women and only dhoti with towel for men) Shirt and T-shirts are not allowed
2. Temple dharshan timings are quite different from other temples....plan accordingly
3. Early morning Dharshan is less crowded, otherwise there is a waiting period of 1-2 hours as per crowd
4. Special VIP dharshan tickets are available only in-person inside the temple
5. Cloak rooms are available to keep valuable and cloth
6. It is nice to visit the nearby Ganesha temple along with it
7. There are four gates to enter, the east gate is more crowded.

Have recently visited and was deeply moved by the serene atmosphere and beautiful architecture. The intricate carvings and stunning deities created a sense of tranquility, allowing me to connect with my spirituality. The priests were warm and welcoming, offering insightful guidance and blessings. The community's dedication to preserving traditions and serving devotees is truly commendable. I felt a deep sense of peace and gratitude during my visit. Highly recommended for those seeking spiritual growth and connection.
Security is a bit high compared to any other religious places which may due to the wealthy nature of deity

I visited the temple during the weekend on a Saturday in July month. Instantly fell in love with the atmosphere and calmness inside and around the temple. It's really a divine place and you get to see the lord Vishnu in a resting posture and the spirituality, architecture, cleanliness, security and the experience is top notch.

I took the vip darshan with a ‚Çπ500 ticket and with this you can get the closest to the idol. I went at 8 am and you can enter through any of the four gates. Tickets are avilable inside the temple. After security check at the entrance head straight to the ticket counter and then joined the queue. Within 30 mins I was infront of lord Vishnu and asked for his blessings. No rush, no pushing and ample time in front of the idol was allowed. Post the darshana, I got prasadam which was included in the ticket price. Then visited lord Ganesha as well which is withing the temple complex. My heart and mind was at peace and I sat there admiring the temple architecture and beauty.

Temple timing are displayed at the entrance and special puja ticket of around ‚Çπ3000 is also available. Best time for free darshana is to go early morning when the temple opens at 3am.

Also please note that dress code need to be strictly followed and no electronic item are allowed inside the temple. You get locker and  bathing facility at nominal rates.

The temple is¬†well maintained¬†and has effective management of the queues for devotees, helping to maintain order during busy times. A convenient¬†locker facility¬†is also available for visitors to securely store their belongings.

The temple is located¬†near Trivandrum Central Railway Station and the main bus stop, both within walking distance, making it easily accessible for travelers. Overall, it is an excellent place for spiritual solace combined with good visitor facilities and easy access from transport hubs.

The best time for darshan is between 3:30 AM and 4:45 AM.

Had a very good darshan. I chose the very first darshan timing slot, which was 3:30 to 4:45 AM. Then second darshan slot is 6:30 to 7:30 amd so on. Kindly see the suitable darshan timing on website and then visit accordingly to avoid the closure of gate(patt). There is a dress code, mundu (dhoti) for men and saree or half saree for women. Churidar is not allowed. You have the option to buy the saree/dhoti if u don‚Äôt have the same. Locker facilities are available for phone and other belongings.

Sri Padmanabhaswamy Temple in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, is a revered Hindu shrine dedicated to Lord Vishnu, depicted in a reclining posture on the serpent Anantha. Renowned for its Dravidian architecture and spiritual significance, the temple is one of the 108 Divya Desams dedicated to Vishnu. The temple's main deity is composed of 12,008 saligrams, fossilized shells from the Gandaki River in Nepal, and is preserved using a unique Ayurvedic mixture called "Katusarkara yogam" .

The temple is also famous for its treasure vaults, which were discovered to contain immense wealth, including gold, jewels, and artifacts, making it one of the richest temples in the world . In June 2025, the temple hosted a rare Maha Kumbhabhishekam, a consecration ritual conducted after nearly 270 years, marking a significant event in its history .

Visitors are required to adhere to a strict dress code: men must wear a white dhoti with an angavastram, and women should wear a sari. Entry is permitted only to Hindus, as per the Temple Entry Proclamation . The temple opens for darshan at 3:15 am and closes at 7:20 pm, with various slots for prayers and rituals throughout the day .

While the temple offers a profound spiritual experience, some visitors have reported issues such as overcrowding and lack of proper guidance for tourists . Additionally, the temple's treasure vaults have been a subject of legal and spiritual debates, adding to its mystique and intrigue .

Overall, Sri Padmanabhaswamy Temple stands as a testament to Kerala's rich cultural and spiritual heritage, offering visitors a glimpse into the region's deep-rooted traditions and beliefs.

placeMetadata.name: Veli Lake Tourist Village

sources.snippet: Veli Tourist Village is a picturesque waterfront area where Veli lake meets Arabian Sea. The village has facilities like boating rides, pedal boating and a children's park meant for family photography. Such a peaceful inland water system provides an amazing background for landscape photography enriched by swaying coconuts trees, colorful house boats etc.The floating bridge plus sculpture garden are additional features you might want to include in your photos.

reviews.reviewText: It's a serene atmosphere where you can see the confluence of Veli lake and Arabian sea. Veli Tourist Village, located at the confluence of the Veli Lake and the Arabian Sea, is a serene and well-maintained tourist spot perfect for families, couples, and photography lovers. The moment you enter, you're greeted by vast greenery, calm backwaters, and a fresh breeze that sets the tone for a relaxed outing.

The village features boating facilities, children's play areas, landscaped gardens, and charming walkways that make it ideal for a peaceful stroll. The highlight is the floating bridge that connects to the beach‚Äîoffering a unique experience and beautiful sunset views. There are also sculptures scattered throughout the park, adding an artistic touch.

Boating on the lake is a popular activity, and pedal boats and rowboats are available. There are a few food stalls and a KTDC-run restaurant offering decent local cuisine.

Veli Tourist Village
Veli Tourist Village in Thiruvananthapuram, located 10-12 km from the city center, is a scenic gem where Veli Lake meets the Arabian Sea. Perfect for families, the park offers a serene floating bridge with stunning views and a unique lake-sea confluence. The solar-powered toy train is a delightful 2.5-km ride, winding through lush greenery, captivating both kids and adults. Boating‚Äîpedal boats (‚Çπ100 for 30 mins, 2-seater) and speed boats (‚Çπ700-1000 for 4-6 people)‚Äîis a highlight, though rides can feel short. The children‚Äôs park, with swings, slides, and Kanayi Kunhiraman‚Äôs sculptures, adds charm.
Food options, like the KTDC floating restaurant, serve decent South Indian fare but are limited and pricey. Entry is affordable (‚Çπ5-30), with parking at ‚Çπ10-20. However, litter and broken equipment detract from the experience, and crowds swell in evenings. Adding water sports like kayaking could boost appeal. Overall, a relaxing half-day outing with great potential‚Äîbetter maintenance would help. I

reviews.reviewText:
Attukal Bhagavathi Temple is a famous temple of Goddess Kannaki/Bhadrakali  at Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala.
Darsanam to Northwards.

Most of the famous temples  in kerala are with ancient mythological history, but Attukal is comparativly a small temple of Goddess and became famous during the last 50years.
It became famous due to insurge of devotees specifically women to worship the Goddess with their nivedyam known as Pongal.

Upadevatha (Subdeities): Ganapathi, Sivan, Naga, Madan Thampuran...

Vazhipadu: Special Vazhipadu is Kalabhabhishekam and
Lighting of Lemon lamps infront of the temple.
All other offerings as per Devi temples.

Temple: Attukal temple was a small temple and recently renovated with Nalambalam, Gopurams etc. Temple structure is a mix of Kerala and Tamil Architecture styles.

Festivals: Ten days festival during month Kumbham starting on Karthika day and ending on Uthram day. The ten days festival is celebrated with different temple rituals, Thaalapoli for girls and Chooral kuthu for boys and variety of Stage shows.
Ninth day of festival, on Pooram day pongala nivedyam by women devotees is celebrated.

Attukal pongala is considered as the most famous ritual celebrated by women devotees now in kerala. Lakhs of women devotees are gathering in and around the temple premise to prepare pongala to submit Devi as nivedyam.
Now around 10km radius of the temple will be gathered by these women devotees to perform this ritual, literally Thiruvananthapuram city will be in stand still condition on the day.
Also very recently this festival has been entered in to guinnes book of world records for the 'largest gathering of women' for a festival within a day.

History/Mythology:
An old man living near Attukal was so happened to see an young girl near the bank of Killiyar and  helped her to cross the river and received as a guest to his family. But the same night she disapperaed and appeared through a dream to the man as a goddess and requested to put a small temple for her in an identified nearby location. Hence as per the advise from the Hindu priests also, he initiated to build a small temple to worship the divine power of Devi for the devotees.

How ever this temple has some spiritual and functional link with the famous Kodungalloor temple and it is belived that the Devi who appeared to the old man was Kannaki on her way to Kodungalloor after destroying Madurai city of Pandya dynasty.
The Thottampattukal which is being sung during the festival days are the history of Kannaki from Chilappathikaram written by the great Tamil Poet Elankovadikal can be considered as a proof of this mythology.

Also it is believed the Deity, Dharmasathavu of a nearby temple at Manacaud has a brother-sister relation to Attukal devi and accordingly some rituals/functions are being performed between these temples as part of festival celebration.

Location/Travel: At Attukal of Thiruvananthapuram Corporation around 2-3kms from East fort and Thampanur Railway station /Bus station.

Facility: Large vehicle parking space, Washrooms, small fancy shops etc. are available within the temple compound.
Also a Hospital and Kalyanamandapam are functioned within the temple premise under Attukal Devaswam trust.

Visiting the Aattukal Bhagavathy Temple is truly a soul-stirring experience. The moment you step into the temple premises, you're enveloped in a powerful spiritual aura that radiates positivity and deep devotion. There's an inexplicable peace in the air, and the atmosphere is charged with pure divine energy.

Every visit leaves you feeling more grounded, blessed, and spiritually fulfilled. Whether you're a believer or a casual visitor, the positive vibes of this temple are undeniable and unforgettable. A must-visit for anyone seeking peace, strength, and the grace of the Goddess

Recently visited and was deeply moved by the serene atmosphere and beautiful ambiance. The community's dedication to preserving traditions and serving devotees is truly commendable. felt a deep sense of peace and gratitude during our visit. Highly recommended for those seeking spiritual growth and connection."!

Temple Review: Attukal Bhagavathy Temple

A beautiful and serene temple experience. The temple is well-maintained and not overly crowded, which makes it easy to get darshanam within 10‚Äì15 minutes. The atmosphere is peaceful, and the staff are helpful.

There‚Äôs also an Indian coffee house nearby, making it convenient for visitors. The food is reasonably priced and offers a good variety of traditional options.

Overall, a pleasant and spiritually fulfilling visit. Highly recommended if you're in the area.

Attukal Bhagavathi Temple is a Hindu Shrine located at Attukal Thiruvananthapuram Kerala India. This colourful temple dedicated to Goddess Bhadrakali ( Kannaki), a form of Mahalakshmi the Goddess of prosperity and salvation. She is also identified with Kannaki the heroine of Tamil epic Cilapathikaram. The temple structure is a mix of Kerala and Tamilnadu traditional styles. "Attukal Pongala" got a Guinness book record for being the single largest gathering of women for a religious activity. Devotees believed that all of their wishes are fulfilled by the Goddess.  Thousands of women devotees participated to prepare Pongala festival   ........ a sweet dish made of rice, jaggery and coconut to submit Devi as           "nivedhyam ".

The temple is a must visit for devotees seeking divine blessing and it was a special experience such deep faith and togetherness.
Spacious parking space, sufficient washrooms and some shops are available . Also a Hospital and Kalyanamandapam  inside the premise.  Easy to access by Public Transport.

Very lucky to be in this temple on a day of less crowd despite being a Friday. Everything about this place is high positive energy. Abhishekam and ezhunallathu is an altogether surreal experience. Amme Narayana

Attukal Bhagavathy Temple, located in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, is renowned as the "Women's Sabarimala" due to the large number of female devotees who visit the temple. The temple is dedicated to Goddess Attukal Bhagavathy, believed to be an incarnation of Goddess Parvati.

The temple is famous for the annual Attukal Pongala festival, which is the largest gathering of women for a religious event in the world. During Pongala, millions of women gather to prepare Pongala, a sweet dish offered to the deity. The festival's atmosphere is filled with devotion and communal harmony.

The temple's architecture reflects traditional Kerala style, with intricate carvings and a serene ambiance. The temple complex also includes other deities, and the rituals and ceremonies are conducted with great devotion.

The Attukal Bhagavathy Temple is not only a place of worship but also a symbol of women's empowerment and spiritual strength. The temple's significance lies in its ability to bring together women from all walks of life in a shared act of devotion. The temple's peaceful environment and the warmth of the devotees create a unique spiritual experience.

Aattukaal Bhagavathi (Devi) temple is the temple which has a Guinness World Record of biggest annual gathering of women devotees during the programme 'Attukal Ponkala'. The history of Attukal Devi is tied to the legend of Kannaki, the heroine of the Tamil epic Silapathikaram. Kannaki's husband was unjustly executed, leading her to destroy the city of Madurai in righteous anger. On her journey to a shrine, she stopped in the Attukal area, where women welcomed her and offered her porridge. Her anger subsided, and she transformed into the motherly Goddess Parvati. In her memory, women annually offer porridge at the temple in the Attukal Pongala festival, which honors the goddess.

reviews.reviewText:
I visited Shangumugham beach in the early morning for a walk. It was beautiful to enjoy the sea shore. The sound of waves, cool breeze and less crowded in the early morning felt amazing.

You can enjoy great views of sea shore on both the sides. It's a long coastal area.

It's a tourist attraction that needs a lot of improvement. The beach is very dirty. The walkway is also not built and maintained properly. The entire area needs to be cleaned properly. There is a lot of scope for this place to become a hot tourist spot.

A peaceful beach to enjoy the sunset. The view is really beautiful, especially in the evening. There‚Äôs a big mermaid statue and plenty of space to walk or relax. Some areas need a bit of cleaning, but overall it‚Äôs a nice spot to chill with friends or family. Close to the airport too. üåäüåÖ

Visited Shanmugham Beach on a sunny day around midday, and it was really hot. But the calming wind gave a lot of relief and made the weather bearable. Went there also to use the public toilet‚Äîit was surprisingly clean and well-maintained. Took some nice pictures and enjoyed the peaceful vibes despite the heat. Overall, it was a refreshing experience and a nice spot to relax for a while. Would definitely visit again, maybe during evening hours for a cooler breeze and sunset views.

A Scenic Beach with Unique Attractions!
Shangumugham Beach is one of the most beautiful beaches in Kerala, offering a serene coastal vibe right near the heart of the city. A massive mermaid sculpture, an iconic piece of art, welcomes you at the entrance, making it a popular photo spot. There's also a helicopter installation placed nearby, which adds to the attraction and catches the attention of tourists.

I visited the beach at the end of May, during the onset of the monsoon season. Due to heavy rainfall, it wasn‚Äôt an ideal time to explore or enjoy the beach fully. I recommend planning your visit during the dry season for the best experience.

Shangumugham Beach, once a bustling, sandy escape, now stands as a stark reminder of Kerala‚Äôs changing coastline. It‚Äôs especially crowded on Sundays‚Äîbut much of the original beach, along with pathways and benches, has been swallowed by relentless sea erosion in recent years. With new coastal projects like Adani‚Äôs underway, the landscape here is set to transform even more dramatically in the next decade, making today‚Äôs sunsets at the shore unique and precious moments. So, visit soon: soak in the vibrant sunset, tread carefully around the water, and make the most of what‚Äôs left of this Thiruvananthapuram icon before it changes forever. PRO tip‚Äîskip the pista flavor at the Amul shop on the premises!

A piece of advice for fellow travelers: cherish this living memory while you can, as Shangumugham Beach is on the brink of becoming part of Kerala‚Äôs coastal history.

I recently visited Shanghumukham Beach in Trivandrum, and I must say it was one of the most peaceful and refreshing experiences I‚Äôve had in a while. The beach has a calm, relaxed vibe that instantly makes you feel at ease. It's perfect for a quiet walk, watching the waves, or just sitting and enjoying the sea breeze.

The beach is wide and open, giving you plenty of space to sit or walk without feeling crowded. I went in the evening, and the sunset view was absolutely stunning ‚Äì the sky turned a beautiful mix of orange and pink as the sun dipped below the horizon. It‚Äôs a perfect spot for photography lovers and anyone who enjoys nature at its best.

One of the highlights of this beach is the huge mermaid sculpture (Sagarakanyaka), which is not only impressive but also adds an artistic and cultural charm to the place. It‚Äôs a unique landmark that you won‚Äôt find at other beaches.

Even though it's close to the city, it doesn‚Äôt feel chaotic. There were families, couples, and tourists ‚Äì but the atmosphere was still peaceful. It‚Äôs also a place of spiritual and cultural importance, especially during certain Hindu festivals when rituals are performed here.

There are a few snack stalls and tea vendors nearby, so you can enjoy a cup of tea or a local bite while watching the waves. The breeze, the sound of the sea, and the open sky make it a great place to unwind.

If you're in Trivandrum and want to experience a blend of natural beauty, culture, and calmness, Shanghumukham Beach is a must-visit. I‚Äôd definitely love to go back again.

recently visited Shankhumugham Beach in Thiruvananthapuram, and it was an incredible experience. The beach is truly beautiful, offering stunning views, especially in the evening. As the sun begins to set, the entire place transforms into a serene and mesmerizing scene‚Äîperfect for a peaceful walk or just soaking in the natural beauty. A must-visit spot if you're in the area!

Nestled in the bustling heart of Trivandrum, near East Fort, the Pazhavangadi Sree Mahaganapathi Temple is a truly special spiritual haven. Dedicated to Lord Ganesha, the temple features a unique idol of the deity in a seated, one-legged pose. Step inside and you'll find a serene, divine ambiance that attracts both devotees and curious visitors. Don't miss the meaningful ritual of breaking coconuts, a symbolic act to remove obstacles. The temple is immaculately kept and runs smoothly, ensuring a pleasant experience. Its prime location makes it a breeze to get to, and the vibrant surroundings only add to the visit's appeal. It's a definite must-see if you're in Trivandrum, whether for blessings or cultural exploration.

Excellent Temple and a touch of antiquity with modern Kerala Temple Architecture, maintained by Indian Army after merger of Travancore army with the forces. With 32 forms of Ganesha this is an amazing Temple to visit. Main Deity is sitting with right leg folded.

Pazhavangadi Sree Mahaganapathi Temple, located in the heart of Trivandrum near East Fort, is a revered spiritual destination. Dedicated to Lord Ganesha, the temple is known for its unique idol of the deity in a seated posture with one leg folded. The temple exudes a peaceful and divine ambiance, attracting devotees and visitors alike.

One of the key rituals here is the breaking of coconuts, symbolizing the removal of obstacles. The temple is well-maintained and efficiently managed, ensuring a smooth experience for visitors. Its central location makes it easily accessible, and the surrounding area is bustling with activity, adding to the charm of the visit. Whether you're seeking blessings or simply exploring Trivandrum's cultural landmarks, this temple is a must-visit.

Pazhavangadi Sree Mahaganapathi Temple, located near East Fort in the heart of Trivandrum, is a beautifully maintained spiritual spot with a blend of antiquity and modern Kerala architecture. Managed by the Indian Army after the Travancore army merger, the temple is dedicated to Lord Ganesha, who is uniquely depicted seated with one leg folded. Housing 32 forms of Ganesha, it offers a serene, divine atmosphere. The popular ritual of breaking coconuts symbolizes the removal of obstacles. Clean, well-managed, and easy to reach, this temple is a must-visit for both devotees and cultural explorers

placeMetadata.name: Kovalam

sources.snippet: Located 13 km from Trivandrum, Kovalam is an idyllic coastal town. It is renowned for its 17 km long coastline and three adjacent crescent-shaped beaches ‚Äì Lighthouse, Hawah, and Samudra. Kovalam boasts about Ayurveda resorts, luxury hotels, and rich cultural heritage, which makes it among the best places to visit in Thiruvananthapuram.

It is also one of the most famous places to visit as part of Kerala tour packages.

placeMetadata.description: Kovalam is a small coastal town in the southern Indian state of Kerala, south of Thiruvananthapuram. At the southern end of Lighthouse Beach is a striped lighthouse with a viewing platform. Palm-backed beaches also include Hawa Beach and Samudra Beach. Heading south, Vizhinjam Juma Masjid mosque overlooks the busy fishing harbor. Inland, Sagarika Marine Research Aquarium displays technology used in pearl production.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Kovalam, a charming coastal town in Kerala, India, is known for its picturesque beaches and vibrant atmosphere. Lighthouse Beach, with its iconic striped lighthouse and panoramic views, is a popular spot for tourists. The town also boasts other beautiful beaches like Hawa Beach and Samudra Beach. Away from the shore, visitors can explore the Vizhinjam Juma Masjid mosque and the bustling fishing harbor.

Akkulam Tourist Village is a calm and peaceful spot located right by the roadside, making it easily accessible. It used to be a nice place to relax and spend some quiet time with family and friends.However, the place is not well maintained nowadays. Cleanliness has become a major issue, and many areas are left untidy, which affects the overall experience. If the authorities could focus on maintaining the space better, this could be a great hangout spot again.

This is a good hangout spot if you ask me. It's good to come with your friends or your partner or want to spend some time alone. It was a quiet place and there were only a few people there. When I went there, it was between 3-4 pm so I'm not sure how it is during the late hours.

It's also a beautiful place for photoshoots and all cause there are beautiful things to capture. There are also some stalls to eat and have fun playing some games.

But there was one thing that I didn't like. Many of the adventure rides weren't open when I went there, and that's not the right thing considering I paid the ticket price as well.

Today, I visited Akkulam Tourist Village. It was nice, but it requires regular upkeep. The project was launched only a few years ago, yet it's not being properly maintained. The water fountain isn't functioning, which is disappointing. Entry to glass bridge is restricted. While launching such projects is a great initiative, maintaining them is equally crucial. Unfortunately, many parks in the city are in similar conditions.

Akkulam Tourist Village (also called Akkulam Adventure Tourism Park) is a delightful picnic-and-adventure destination just ~10‚ÄØkm from Thiruvananthapuram city center, on the serene banks of Akkulam Lake .

---

üåø What Makes It Special

1. Natural Setting & Water Activities

Set amid lush greenery on gentle slopes around the backwaters, with landscaped gardens and mangroves .

The Boat Club offers rowboats, pedal boats, safari boats, and coracle rides across Akkulam and Veli lakes .

2. Fun for All Ages

Children‚Äôs park: swings, rides, bicycle park, zip-lines, sky cycling and more .

Swimming pools: separate paddling pool for kids and adult swimming pool .

Adventure zone: aerial cycling, Burma bridge, zip‚Äëcycle, fish‚Äëspa, virtual reality zone, battery‚Äëcars etc. .

3. Cultural & Edutainment Attractions

Air Force Museum with flight simulator, model aircraft exhibits and interactive displays .

Musical/dancing fountain, light & sound theatre, artificial waterfalls, future amphitheatre & digital fountains .

4. Phase II Upgrades

Glass bridge (~80‚ÄØm above ground)Â∑≤ÂêØÂä®È¶ñÁõ∏Âª∫ËÆæ in 2023‚ÄîKerala's first .

Updates include toy‚Äëtrain, pets‚Äô park, mud‚Äërace track, virtual‚Äëreality zone, improved infrastructure .

5. Events & Community Life

Hosts art workshops, summer camps, treasure hunts, craft events on weekends and holidays .

---

üìå Practical Details

---

‚úÖ Why Visit?

A one‚Äëstop destination: nature, family fun, adventure, culture‚Äîgreat for all ages.

Recently upgraded infrastructure with exciting new features like the glass bridge and adventure park.

Community hub hosting workshops, camps, festivals‚Äîadds charm beyond tourism.

---

üöß A Few Cautions

Maintenance issues: A 2024 report flagged poor sanitation, water/power interruptions, non-functional CCTV, and reduced revenue .

Crowds may swell on peak days‚Äîarrive early to beat queues.

---

üí° Insider Tips

Opt for weekday visits or early weekend mornings.

Combine it with a trip to Veli Tourist Village‚Äîpossibly linked by boat in the future .

Keep an eye out for workshops/events advertised via DTPC and community groups.

---

‚úçÔ∏è Summary Note

Akkulam Tourist Village blends Kerala's backwater beauty with engaging attractions‚Äîboating, adventure, water fun, cultural experiences, and educational zones‚Äîall within a single complex. Ideal for family day-outs, offbeat leisure, or a refreshing nature retreat close to the city. Future improvements like the glass bridge and better maintenance promise even more memorable visits.

The dishes were flavourful and fresh‚Äîespecially the [mention a dish, like "paneer tikka" or "chicken fried rice"]. Kalluz enjoyed the soft naan and mildly spiced dal. Clean washrooms, baby-friendly ambiance, and hassle-free parking made the whole experience very smooth for us as parents.

reviews.reviewText:
I recently had the pleasure of visiting Magic Planet, and I must say, it was an enchanting experience from start to finish! The moment I stepped inside, I was greeted by the warm, smiling faces of the staff who truly made me feel welcome (special mention to Miss Shamna)

The cleanliness of the facility was impressive. It‚Äôs clear that they prioritize not just the fun experiences, but also the safety and comfort of their guests.
The variety of shows offered is fantastic, catering to all age groups and interests. Whether you're a fan of magic, acrobatics, or theatrical performances, there's something for everyone. I particularly enjoyed the interactive elements of the show, which made it feel personal and engaging.

What really stood out to me was Magic Planet's commitment to giving back to the community. I learned about their various charity initiatives, and it warmed my heart to see a business that not only focuses on entertainment but also on making a positive impact in the lives of others. Their efforts to support local charities and engage with the community truly set them apart.

Overall, my experience at Magic Planet was magical in every sense of the word. From the friendly staff to the immaculate surroundings and their charitable endeavors, I left feeling uplifted and inspired. I highly recommend visiting Magic Planet for a day of fun and joy‚Äîit's a place where smiles are contagious, and the magic is real!

Magic Planet truly lives up to its name, offering a magical experience for all ages. It‚Äôs a brilliant realization of the inspiring vision of the great magician,¬†Sri Gopinath Muthukad. Hats off to his dedication in empowering gifted children, helping them become self-reliant and financially independent by bringing them into the spotlight.
What stood out the most was the¬†exceptional customer service. Every staff member we encountered was warm, welcoming, and went above and beyond to ensure our visit was memorable. Whether assisting with shows, guiding us around, or simply sharing a friendly smile, their professionalism and kindness made a lasting impression.
We left with joyful hearts and unforgettable memories. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a truly magical day out

A wonderful experience With family. A full day packed program. We went with children. The money we spent there is worth every penny. Children can learn a lot of things about another side of childhood where our differently abled children their entire childhood in colours instead of chaos. They grow, live, learn and earn with Magic Planet. I would recommend this place as a must visit place for everyone. Also keep in mind the shows are understandable for kids above 5 years only.  The full day program includes a food and snack facility on the campus itself. Ample parking is available.

It was a nice experience and a unforgettable day in my life.
From 9am to 5 pm we are in a another world. Love and care in everyone and everything inside magic planet‚ù§Ô∏è
I would definitely recommend to anyone  looking for a unique experience, the shows are well organized, all are entertaining, the hospitality from staffs are very friendly and lovely.
Must spend a time here.‚ù§Ô∏è

The location is approximately 20 km from the city. It's a 10 am to 6 pm program. Try to join by 10 am. The forenoon session mostly focuses on the performance of differently abled children.

Stepping into Magic Planet was an experience that transcended mere entertainment. This is not just a theme park; it's a unique social experiment that is succeeding with grace and excellence. The park is a platform to empower and rehabilitate an often overlooked community‚Äîdifferently-abled children and street magicians. Seeing these incredible artists perform with such skill, confidence, and sheer joy is breathtaking. The work done here, training and providing a livelihood for these talented individuals, is a rare and beautiful initiative that sets Magic Planet apart from any other attraction.

The park‚Äôs architecture and design are stunning, creating a truly enchanting atmosphere. Every corner of the park is thoughtfully crafted to ignite the imagination. The magic and circus sessions are, without a doubt, scintillating. The illusions are world-class, the acrobatics are gravity-defying, and the performances are delivered with professionalism and passion, keeping you on the edge of your seat. The variety of shows, from close-up magic to grand illusions, ensures that there is something to captivate every family member.

Every staff member we interacted with was incredibly polite, sensible, and genuinely helpful. Their care and attention to detail, especially in managing a crowd with diverse needs, speak volumes about the place's ethos.

This was my second visit to Magic Planet, and it was even better than the first. I was pleasantly surprised to learn they no longer charge for entry but instead accept donations.
Honestly, I feel they should charge for such a fantastic package of entertainment. To show our support for their noble cause‚Äîempowering differently-abled children and street magicians‚Äîmy family and I happily donated ‚Çπ1000 per person.

The food options were simple and average: a Kerala style basic veg meal and chicken biryani.

In a world full of commercial attractions, Magic Planet stands out as a beacon of hope and humanity.

A full five stars and our highest recommendation!

This place truly lives up to its name ‚Äì Magic!
They empower physically and mentally challenged individuals by teaching them magic and inspiring them in the most beautiful way. Being there fills your heart with warmth, and time just flies without you even realizing it.

We visited this gem while on vacation in Trivandrum. It was a rainy day, and we decided to spend some time here ‚Äî and I must say, it turned out to be the highlight of our trip!

Experiences like this deserve to be brought to cities like Bangalore too ‚Äî I‚Äôm sure it would be a huge success. Wishing the entire team all the very best. So proud of the work you're doing!

A Beautiful place you can spent the whole day with differently abled children, a lot of interesting and fun show by children‚Äôs, professional performance, great experience, more than 10 performances, starting from 10AM till 5PM, the lunch served is also very professional. All a wonderful day, Thx for Sir Muthukad for this wonderful creation.

A beautyful place.  Every one should visit at least once in their life time.  Well maintained and organized.  The they treet and train the disabled people.... No words to explain. It is really worth visiting.  Wish them all the very best in their feature projects.  May God shower all blessings to the team and especially the creator Gopinath sir.  He was out when I visited.  I wish him all the success.

placeMetadata.name: Vizhinjam Light House

sources.snippet: Located approximately 17 kilometers from Trivandrum city, Vizhinjam Lighthouse is a prominent landmark situated on the rocky cliffs of Kovalam Beach. The lighthouse stands at a height of 36 meters and is perched on a hill, offering panoramic views of the Arabian Sea, the crescent-shaped Kovalam beaches, and the lush greenery surrounding the area.

sources.snippet: One of Kerala‚Äôs most impressive and longstanding landmarks is Vizhinjam Lighthouse. Located near Kovalam Beach, the lighthouse has been standing over this old seaport for decades. According to the history of Vizhinjam, the seaport was active up until the 19th century when it fell into neglect.

placeMetadata.description: Traditional red-&-white striped lighthouse, constructed in 1972, with an interior spiral staircase.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled near the picturesque Kovalam beach in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, the Vizhinjam Lighthouse is a striking red-and-white striped beacon that has been guiding sailors since its completion in 1972. Standing tall at 36 meters on Kurumkal Hill, this lighthouse not only serves as a vital navigational aid but also offers breathtaking panoramic views of the Arabian Sea and the surrounding lush landscapes.
placeMetadata.address: 9XMH+5V4, Light house Junction, Vizhinjam, near Kovalam, Kovalam, Kerala 695521, India

reviews.reviewText:
A Hidden Gem with a Breathtaking View!

Vizhinjam Lighthouse is an absolute must-visit if you're near Kovalam or Thiruvananthapuram. It's not a very large lighthouse, but the view from the top is incredible. You get a 360-degree panoramic view of the Arabian Sea, nearby beaches, and the surrounding greenery.

The climb to the top is short but steep‚Äîaround 140 steps and a narrow spiral staircase at the end. It‚Äôs manageable for most people, and totally worth it for the scenery. The breeze up there is refreshing, especially around sunset.

The lighthouse is well-maintained and there‚Äôs a small museum that gives you some interesting background on maritime history and navigation. Staff were polite and helpful.

Pro tip: Try to go during clear weather, preferably in the late afternoon, and bring your camera‚Äîthe sunset view is unforgettable!

Entry Fee: Very reasonable (‚Çπ20‚Äì‚Çπ30 when I visited).
Timing: Check before going, as it sometimes closes around noon and reopens in the afternoon.
Parking: Available nearby.

Highly recommended if you're in the area and want to enjoy a peaceful spot with a stunning view. üåÖ

Located near Kovalam in Thiruvananthapuram. A must-visit spot for those who love scenic views and calm surroundings. Perched on a hilltop, it offers breathtaking panoramic views of the Arabian Sea, golden beaches, and lush greenery. The climb to the top is short but rewarding, and once you reach the viewing deck, the cool breeze and stunning vistas make it unforgettable, especially during sunset. The lighthouse is well-maintained, with a small museum showcasing its history. It‚Äôs a perfect blend of history, beauty, and relaxation - recommended for travelers and photographers.

If you are in trivandrum or kovalam you should not miss this spot. The light house opens at 2pm and we were one of the first to get in. They have a lift for people who fear climbing up :) The view from the top is breathtaking. See some of the snaps I got you will know. Since we visited during monsoons the wind was just pushing you all over and it was fun. A must visit spot to get a eagle view of Vizhinjam Harbour, beach and city and the wide expanse of sea. Just loved it. Keep some time at hand it's a great spot to spend an hour or more.

Vizhinjam Light house is the iconic landmark of the Kovalam beach and it looks really impressive in the night when it lights up the night sky. The view from the top is really splendid but it closes by 5 pm so you can only enjoy it in the day light. The way to the top of the lighthouse is very narrow and claustrophobic (it has a lift also) and can get really crowded and one may have to wait a minimum of 40 to 50 mins just to get down from the tower. So better go when the crowd is less. Otherwise it's just too good to admire it from a distance with the scenic ocean view and scintillating winds and waves. üåäüèñÔ∏èü™∏üêüThe entry fees is 30 which adds Rs 10 as extra fee for photography.

Breathtaking Views from the Lighthouse

I recently visited the Lighthouse in Kovalam, and it was an unforgettable experience.The lighthouse offers a superb view of Kovalam Beach, making it a must-visit spot for anyone looking to take in the natural beauty of the area.
Beautiful Spot : The lighthouse is a picturesque spot that's perfect for photography and relaxation.
Children's Park : The availability of a children's park nearby makes it a great destination for families.
Cafe : There's a small cafe on site, providing a convenient spot to grab a snack or drink.

Notes:
Cash Only: Please note that only cash is accepted for ticket purchases, so it's best to come prepared.
Lift Facility: The lighthouse has a lift facility, making it accessible for visitors with mobility issues.

If you're planning to visit Kovalam, make sure to add the lighthouse to your itinerary.

You can climb till the top. Lift facility is there, but was not operational on the day we went there. If you are travelling with old people, better call and go. Small children‚Äôs park is also beneath there. A good place for the family. And the view from above is beyond words. You can have the full view of the beach and the new container terminal

I visited this Lighthouse yesterday and had an overall enjoyable experience. The place offers a peaceful and refreshing atmosphere, ideal for a relaxed outing. The ambience was pleasant, and the surroundings were clean, neat, and well kept.

The staff were friendly and welcoming, which added positively to the experience. Unlike many tourist spots, it wasn't overcrowded, so we could take our time exploring the area and enjoying the views. Parking was easy and convenient, with enough space and no hassle, which is a big plus.

The entry ticket was reasonably priced, making it accessible for everyone. The area around the lighthouse is quite spacious, but unfortunately, the space doesn‚Äôt seem to be fully utilized. There is a lot of untapped potential here if developed properly with some tourist-friendly additions like a caf√©, souvenir shop, or seating/viewing areas, it could become a major attraction.

One of the best highlights was the view from the top of the lighthouse absolutely breathtaking! You get a panoramic view of the sea and coastline, and it‚Äôs definitely worth the visit just for that. It was also great to see that the top area was clean, safe, and well maintained. For those who may find climbing stairs difficult, there is a lift facility, which is very thoughtful and convenient.

One drawback, however, was that digital payments were not accepted. In today‚Äôs time, especially at tourist spots, having UPI or card options is expected and would greatly help both local and international visitors. Overall, a great place to visit with potential for more. A little more development and modernization especially with facilities like digital payment would take this destination to the next level.

In summary, Vizhinjam Lighthouse is a great spot to visit if you're in the area. It offers peace, scenic views, and a clean environment. With some improvements in utilizing the available space and adding a few more attractions or amenities, this place can easily become a top tier tourist destination.

The Vizhinjam Lighthouse is a striking coastal landmark perched on the top of Kurumkal Hill near Kovalam, Thiruvananthapuram district, Kerala  . Rising about 36‚ÄØm (118‚ÄØft) with its red-and-white banded cylindrical tower, it offers breathtaking views from a focal height of 57‚ÄØm above sea level
Built and commissioned in June 1972 (equipment installed May 1972), the light was upgraded with a 450‚ÄØW metal halide lamp and modern drive mechanism in April 2003 .Climb 144 spiral steps or use the lift for most of the way (final stretch via stairs). Once at the top, you're rewarded with panoramic 360¬∞ vistas of Kovalam‚Äôs Lighthouse Beach, Eve‚Äôs Beach (Hawa Beach), rocky shoreline, palm groves, and distant harbor activity  .

Timings (usually open Tuesday‚ÄìSunday):

Morning Slot: 10:00‚ÄØAM ‚Äì 12:30‚ÄØPM (or 12:45‚ÄØPM)

Afternoon Slot: 02:00‚ÄØPM ‚Äì 05:45‚ÄØPM (or till 6:00‚ÄØPM)

Closed on Mondays

placeMetadata.name: Karikkakom Sree Chamundi Temple

sources.snippet: Adding to the historical significance and cultural diversity of the little yet vibrant city of Karikkakom is the Karikkakom Sree Chamundi Devi Temple which is over 600 years old. This ancient temple is set in dense green environs with the tall lush palms enveloping it from all sides. The Karikkakom Devi Temple is a Hindu temple that enshrines Goddess Chamundi.

sources.snippet: Dedicated to the hindu goddess Chamunda, Karikkakom Sree Chamundi Devi Temple is believed to be over 600 years old. The three form of goddess chamunda is worshipped here- Maha Chamundi, Rakhta Chamundi and Bala Chamundi. Being built in absolute green surrounding, this temple has religious as well as historical importance.

placeMetadata.description: Hindu temple featuring a bright tower, elaborate carvings & a pond, devoted to the goddess Chamundi.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Karikkakom Sri Chamundi Temple is a 600-year-old Hindu temple dedicated to the goddess Chamundi. It features a bright tower, intricate carvings, and a serene pond. The temple is set in lush green surroundings and is revered by worshippers of Goddess Kali. It holds historical significance as it was once the site for delivering justice during the monarchy era.
placeMetadata.address: Karikkakom, Karikkakam, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala 695007, India

reviews.reviewText:
Karikkakom Sri Chamundi Temple is an ancient and famous temple of Goddess Chamundi in Kerala.
In this temple, the three state or aspect of Devi based on her character, emotion or expression are being worshipped separately in different Sreekovils (Sanctum) as Sri Chamundi, Rakthachamundi and Balachamundi.
It is very rare or one of the kind in Kerala that a Goddess is worshipped in her three identities separately.
They are placed and worshipped in separate Sreekovils of this temple.
Also the main Sreekovil of Sri Chamundi Devi is a unique and spacious one wrt to other temples of Kerala.

Rakthachamundi is an Anger posture of Chamundi devi and Sreekovil is opened based on Nadathurappu Nercha (open the sanctum based on request) by Devotees for fullfillment of their wishes.
The main offering for Rakthachamundi is Sathrusamhara pooja and this sanctum was very famous during King's rule itself for giving chance to disclose the truth for a convicted person and to prove his innocence or revealing  his guilt.
Also it was famous to get back the stolen properties by performing the Nadathurappu Nercha.

Balachamundi is a peacefull posture of Chamundi devi and mainly for giving blessings related to children's problems.

Upadevatha (Subdeities): Ganapathi, Balaganapathi, Sasthavu, Naga Yakshi, Gurunathan etc.

Pooja: Daily pooja during Morning, Noon time and Evening.
Pooja on Fridays and Pournami days are special in Devi temples.
Pooja timings:
Morning 05.00 to 11.50
Evening 16.30 to 20.10
Timings are slightly stretched during festival days.

Vazhipadu (Offerings): All offerings as per Devi temples are available, however, Devi Sahasranamarchana,  Raktha Pushpanjali, Thechi mala, Kadumpayasam, Palpayasam, Panchamrithm etc. are special.
Conducting Swayamvarapooja and Saree charthu offering to Devi is for getting better and quick marriage alliances.
Wearing Charadu (cotton thread) and Thakidu (metal slice) after pooja are very popular against Mental fears and Nightmares.

Festivals: Main festival during month Meenam with Pongala Nivedyam on Makam day and is celebrated with different temple rituals, Thaalapoli and variety of Stage shows.
Navarathri festival also is celebrated with variety of Performing Arts.

Location/Travel: At Karikkakom of Thiruvananthapuram Corporation near to Thiruvananthapuram North Railway station by the side of Thiruvananthapuram NH66 bypass.
Access from Service road of Bypass and from Thiruvananthapuram North Railway station road also.

Facility: Vehicle parking space, Washrooms, small restaurants and fancy shops  are available within the temple compound.

NB: Devotees are coming and praying in this temple mainly for removing their burdens and to lead a peacefull life, and also for recovering from their illness.
However, the serene village ambience and spiritual divinity within this temple will definitly be a blissful feeling for the devotees.
I visited this place on festival time .its a different kind of energy level of stage programs almost good to visit this temple

One of the most powerful Devi temples I have visited.  We were just spellbound by the beautifully lit Devi, glowing in the light of many diyas.  Mesmerizing.  Hardly any crowd and we had a very peaceful Darshanam.  The special attraction was a dance performance by little children.  This is very close to the airport and a must visit place in tvm.

Centuries old Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Chamundeshwari in Thiruvananthapuram City.

Majestic and Divine atmosphere ideal for a Hindu temple. During special occasions and festival days lakhs of devotees comes to this temple. Temple is truly an Architectural marvel and well maintained by the by Karikkakom Chamundi Temple Trust.
Must visit temple for all Devi devotees atleast once in your lifetime. üòáüôèüèª

The deity here is chamundi devi in kaali form a manifestation of adiparasakthi. The same bhagawathy concept is worshipped here in three aspects such as goddesses saraswathy, lakshmi and durga. The idol of karikakath amma as the deity is so called is made of panchaloha placed gracefully in the sanctum sanctum enabling a smooth darshan from a distance itself. The two sub shrines adjacent to the main deity, raktha chamundi in fierce form and balachamundi in peaceful form placed in wall paintings kept closed and will be opened for a few seconds as offerings known as 'nada thurapikal' is mostly sought by devotees coming here. Beautifully placed here sub idols of mahaganapathi, dharmasastha, bhuvaneswari, ayiravelliswarar lord Shiva, nagarajavu, guru and manthramoorthy. The most outstanding side of this temple is that all the deities are well placed and can be worshipped very conveniently in a peaceful manner without any disturbance of pulling out by securities. Pongala is the main ritual held in malayalam month of meenam annually with much fanfare and high devotee participation and is one of the popular religious ceremonies in thiruvananthapuram. Temple located   nearby technopark, infosys, akulam lake, lulu mall, north railway station and airport.  Bus services available. Vast parking area. No dress code. Flowers, oil, incense sticks, camphor etc to the temple available. Food outlets nearby totally unhygienic. Pilgrim groups can take rest and have toilet facilities here.
Sri Chamundi temple is a divine, place with blessings from devi. Large parking area. Open temple campus which feels like you have come to a village.
Went for the Pooja of the newly purchased vehicle. The entire process was smooth. Must-visit temple. The atmosphere was peaceful and energetic.

The Karikkakom Sree Chamundi Temple transcends conventional religious architecture to constitute a profound spiritual nexus whose transformative influence resonates deeply within every visitor. This sacred precinct functions as a repository of concentrated divine energy, orchestrating an encounter that synthesizes transcendental serenity with profound emotional resonance.

Theological Dimensions and Atmospheric Qualities: The temple's distinctive theological framework centers upon the veneration of Goddess Chamundi manifested through three discrete incarnations, each commanding individual sanctuaries. Devotees encounter the formidable, sanguinary presence of Raktha Chamundi, the benevolent protective essence of Maha Chamundi, and the nurturing maternal embodiment of Bala Chamundi. This tripartite devotional structure presents an extraordinarily rare phenomenological experience. The ambient atmosphere achieves a palpable saturation of devotional intensity, while an immediate sense of profound tranquility envelops visitors upon entering the sacred boundaries.

Architectural Heritage and Stewardship: The structure exemplifies Kerala's architectural traditions through sophisticated timber craftsmanship and canonical spatial organization that cultivates reverent contemplation. Maintenance standards demonstrate exceptional rigor, while administrative protocols ensure remarkable organizational discipline even during periods of substantial congregational attendance. The temple trust demonstrates commendable dedication to preserving both the sanctity and cultural patrimony of this venerated site.

Ritual Practices and Devotional Expression: Observing the profound spiritual commitment of the devotees constitutes a remarkable anthropological study. Many undertake the demanding "Dandanamaskaram"‚Äîa circumambulatory prostration ritual that manifests extraordinary devotional dedication. Ceremonial observances proceed with meticulous precision and genuine reverence. Visitation during Tuesdays or Fridays, deemed particularly auspicious for Devi worship, provides optimal exposure to the temple's complete devotional intensity, albeit with correspondingly increased attendance.

Whether one approaches as a committed devotee seeking divine intervention, a spiritual practitioner pursuing contemplative solitude, or a cultural observer investigating regional heritage, Karikkakom Temple delivers an indelible experiential encounter. For visitors to Thiruvananthapuram seeking authentic engagement with potent divine presence and witnessing faith in its most distilled expression, this institution demands unqualified endorsement.
